item.title: Arbaaz Khan is keeping a close eye on ‘Queen’, ‘Bewakoofiyaan’, ‘O Teri’
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: As a producer, Arbaaz is keeping a close eye on the kind of feedback that his actors are fetching.
item.content:encoded:
Arbaaz Khan: It is always good to see your leading man showing such good range. (Photo: Varinder Chawla)

These are indeed curious times for Arbaaz Khan. While his production ‘Dolly Ki Doli’ is all set to go on floors later this month, his principle cast is seeing a release of another set of their films on back to back weeks.

“First it was Rajkummar Rao who was seen in ‘Queen’. Then this week there is Sonam Kapoor being seen in ‘Bewakoofiyaan’. And in a few days from now, Pulkit Samrat’s ‘O Teri’ would hit the screens. It is uncanny that each of these films has arrived in March and the lead cast members would now be coming together for another new film of theirs,” informs a source.

As a producer, Arbaaz is keeping a close eye on the kind of feedback that his actors are fetching as well as the box office response to these films. For starters, ‘Queen’ is a good success, both commercially and critically and though the film primarily belongs to Kangna Ranaut, even Rajkumar is fetching some good appreciation for his grey characterization.

“It is always good to see your leading man showing such good range,” says Arbaaz, “Even though Rajkumar’s part in ‘Dolly Ki Doli’ is completely different from the kind that we saw in ‘Queen’, it is heartening to know that there is so much talent out there waiting to be explored. He has a good range and I am waiting to see him in action for an altogether different role that he has to play in ‘Dolly Ki Doli’.”

He is also happy with the way Sonam approached her part in this week’s release ‘Bewakoofiyaan’. Though the role didn’t quite demand as much histrionics, as was the case in Sonam’s last release ‘Raanjhanaa’, the actress has fitted in well into the rom-com as a young working woman in an urban contemporary set up.

“I think it is a sweet and feel good film. Moreover, Sonam came up with a natural performance and ensured that the smiles were on. Rest assured, she has a challenging outing ahead in ‘Dolly Ki Doli’. You would see many more different shades of her in this dramatic fun affair,” ensures Arbaaz.

Meanwhile he is now looking forward to how audience responds to Pulkit Samrat’s act in brother-in-law Atul Agnihotri’s ‘O Teri’. Coming straight from a confident act in box office success ‘Fukrey’, he may well have some surprises up his sleeves.

media:content.media:title: Arbaaz Khan: It is always good to see your leading man showing such good range. (Photo: Varinder Chawla)

item.title: Anupam Kher lashes out at wife Kirron’s protesters
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Anupam Kher said, “There were just...maybe 7-8 protesters. A very negligible number of people.”
item.content:encoded:
Anupam Kher said, “There were just…maybe 7-8 protesters. A very negligible number of people.”

When Kirron Kher landed in Chandigarh Tuesday as BJP’s candidate for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections she was apparently greeted by raised slogans and thrown eggs by disappointed locals who felt Kirron was an “outsider.”

Kirron’s husband Anupam who was with her in Chandigarh by chance laughs off the importance given to these protesters. “There were just…maybe 7-8 protesters. A very negligible number of people. And I say, everyone has a right to protest in a democracy. Neither Kirron nor I minded the protest.”

Also Read: I will only campaign for Kirron: Anupam Kher

But why the protests? “They probably felt there were others more qualified for the tickets. But they must understand if the high command thinks a particular candidate is eligible then we mustall respect that decision and not throw tantrums, like a child who has been denied a toy.”

In pics: Kirron Kher greeted with black flags, eggs in Chandigarh

Anupam completely dismisses the enormity of the protests. “It was nothing. So much hue and cry is being made about a handful of protesters. What about the 500 supporters who came to support and cheer Kirron at the airport? As for reports that eggs were thrown at her, please show me those eggs.I’d like to make omelettes of them.”

Anupam says his wife is not the least shaken by the protests. “She is a strong woman, She is getting ready for a long innings in politics. As for me, I’ve no plans of ever getting into active politics. One politician in the family is enough.”

Incidentally Anupam was in Chandigarh to promote his film Gang Of Ghosts. “What a beautiful coincidence. I am glad I could be here to see my wife take her initial steps in this new phase in her life,” signs of the never-say-’dye’ actor.

item.title: Sunny Leone is the USP of ‘Ragini MMS 2′, says director
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Director Bhushan Patel says the major part of the marketing campaign has focused on Sunny Leone's star value.
item.content:encoded:
Director Bhushan Patel says the major part of the marketing campaign has focused on Sunny Leone’s star value.

A year and a half after 1920-Evil Returns, which was a successful sequel to Vikram Bhatt’s 1920, Bhushan Patel is back with another sequel of his directorial career, Ragini MMS 2.

MUST READ: I want to shed my bold avatar post Ragini MMS 2, says Sunny Leone

While the promos of the film as well as a major part of the marketing campaign has focused on Sunny Leone’s star value, Bhushan promises that behind all the glamour and erotica, there is a horror element in the offering with a definite story to be told. Excerpts:

Why so much stress on the ‘horrex’ element when such horror would have been good enough to entice its loyal audience?
Because that’s a concept which is being introduced in the Indian market now! Yes, there have been films with sex and horror combination before but primarily in a Ramsay set up. To entice today’s generation of audience across all centers, the combination has to be shot, presented, promoted and marketed in a certain way. The promise of sex to horror-loving fans is a huge incentive.

Ragini MMS – 2 appears to be going overboard in this direction.
It is by intent! Somehow in this country that we live in, sex and lust as is not considered moral. However, horror and sex go hand in hand when it comes to Ragini MMS – 2. The promos are promising that because I want to sell what I am showing in the film. If visuals like these can titillate as well as scare you, you would enjoy the film.

How are you correctly packaging this aspect of Sunny in the film?
Sunny is my film’s USP and you will see her in different avatars. As a matter of fact, she was always there in the film and came in even before I was signed. People ask me about how she has come across as an actor, considering this is a horror setup. Well, for starters, it is not fair to think that acting is not required for horror films. There are all the facets of acting required here too. With Sunny it was a little difficult to begin with since Hindi is not her first language. Still, she worked very hard. For ‘Baby Doll’, she rehearsed for ten days. She is a director’s actor. I am more than happy with the way she has performed.

Sunny seems to be quite high on the film’s climax. No pun intended!
(Laughs) Well, climax is the high point of any film, and no pun intended here too. On a serious note, what happens is that if your entire film is good but the climax is drab, people step out of a theatre with disappointment. Especially in a horror movie, the climax has to be the scariest. In that aspect, Sunny totally understood the requirement. She has done very well in the climax. She was pulled and pushed around in the harness but she enjoyed these moves as well (smiles)!

item.title: I will only campaign for Kirron: Anupam Kher
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: "I am very proud that she is fighting elections from Chandigarh. She is from Chandigarh and I wish her great luck," Anupam Kher said.
item.content:encoded:
“She is a fantastic friend, wife and a mother. She is a very good wife and she would be a great politician. I am very proud that she is fighting elections from Chandigarh. She is from Chandigarh and I wish her great luck,” he said. (PTI)

Anupam Kher feels his wife Kirron, BJP’s Lok Sabha nominee from Chandigarh, has the qualities to make a great politician and the veteran actor says he would “definitely” campaign for her.

“I am not associated with any political party. I have only campaigned once that was 25 years ago. But I have known Kirron since 1974. For many years she was my friend and she has been my wife for 28 years. If I campaign for anybody that would only be Kirron and I will definitely go,” Anupam, who was in the city to promote his upcoming film ‘Gang of Ghosts’, said. The 59-year-old actor believes that Kirron would accomplish great things as a politician.

“She is a fantastic friend, wife and a mother. She is a very good wife and she would be a great politician. I am very proud that she is fighting elections from Chandigarh. She is from Chandigarh and I wish her great luck,” he said.

‘Gang of Ghosts’, directed by Satish Kaushik, is a remake of Bengali blockbuster ‘Bhooter Bhabishyat’. It is slated to release on March 21.

Besides Anupam, the comedy also features Sharman Joshi, Mahie Gill, Rajpal Yadav, Chunky Pandey, Saurabh Shukla and sister newcomer Meera Chopra, who is a  distant cousin of actresses Priyanka and Parineeti Chopra.

“(The film) is a comedy of characters. It is not a slapstick or situational comedy. The great thing about it is that usually one feels scared about a ghost movie. But here you will fall in love with them. We were lucky and fortunate that we were surrounded by brilliant actors,” Anupam said.

Anupam Kher lauded his longtime friend Satish Kaushik for his acting and filmmaking skills. “I have known him since 1975 from National School of Drama days. After so many years, it is fun to work with him. He is a brilliant director, and a very good actor, We both like to eat. So when all of it gets together, the end product is great,” he said.

Anupam feels that humour serves as an incredible stress buster, which is the reason he constantly endeavours to make his fans laugh.

Anupam feels that humour serves as an incredible stress buster, which is the reason he constantly endeavours to make his fans laugh.

“I love to do comedy as there is too much tragedy in our personal lives. I like to make people laugh because in today’s time, we are living in a world where there is constant competition. You are made to feel an underachiever. So through comedy, I try to make them laugh. It is my contribution in their lives,” he said.

“Also I don’t take myself so seriously, so it’s fun to make people laugh. You spread warmth, love and happiness and if I am the cause of somebody’s happiness, I will be very happy,” he added.

The actor may have proved his comic skills many times in his previous films, but he still considers it as a difficult job.

“It is difficult to make people laugh as it involves the physical reactions from the audience. To make people laugh, you need to have a correct sense of timing and concept. So it’s is difficult,” he said.

item.title: I am a strict mom, Nysa tells me I am hard on her: Kajol
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: Kajol says: "I am very strict and my daughter keeps telling me you are too hard on me, and I keep telling her I have to be hard because if I am not hard."
item.content:encoded:
“I think I am very hands-on mother. I am very strict and my daughter keeps telling me you are too hard on me,” says Kajol.

Actress Kajol, who is supporting a campaign aiming to eradicate diarrhoea by promoting hand-washing habits among children, says she is a strict mother and ensures that her kids lead a disciplined life.

“I think I am very hands-on mother. I am very strict and my daughter keeps telling me you are too hard on me, and I keep telling her I have to be hard because if I am not hard, you will not learn the lessons that I want you to learn. I think it is really important to be that way. It is essential to teach good habits,” Kajol, 39, told PTI in an exclusive interview.

Kajol married actor Ajay Devgn in 1999 and the couple are parents to two kids Nysa and Yug. (Read: Kajol on why she went from drab to fab)

Speaking about her children, she said, “they are bubbly and talkative. They are very confident children, so far they are good. As far as my personality is concerned my daughter is temperamentally a lot like my husband but in some ways she is also like me.” (See Pics: Kajol at Lakme Fashion Week 2014)

“My son is too young so it is difficult to say whose qualities he has more – mine or my husband,” she added.

As a kid, Kajol said she was a brat. “I was a complete brat but was an angel with my mother. I used to be perfectly behaved and my mother used to be like…Really are you badly behaved with other people? I was like no, not at all. But the minute she used to leave the room I was a brat.”

Currently, she is supporting the cause of hand washing with Lifebuoy’s ‘Help A Child Reach 5′.  This campaign was adopted in Thesgora, a village in Madhya Pradesh to inculcate hand washing habits. The incidence of diarrhoea in the village, which had one of the highest rates of the disease, has come down from 36 to 5 per cent.

“We have been promoting this since a year. Most of the children under the age of five were dying due to diarrhoea and pneumonia…It is heartrending as its curable,” she said.

“If through this programme I can save the life of atleast one child I think it would be fabulous. I am proud to support it. The aim is to promote hygiene as it helps in preventing other diseases,” she added.

She reveals they do plan to adopt other villages and want to take this forward in India and 8 other countries.

“It is sad that children are dying due to diarrhoea and pneumonia. It is all about bringing hygiene. I definitely want to join causes that are related to children, I want to stand up for it as I believe in it passionately,” Kajol said.

item.title: Levi Miller cast as Peter Pan in Joe Wright’s movie
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The film titled 'Pan' will be a new take on the classic story.
item.content:encoded:
Actors Hugh Jackman and Garrett Hedlund will also be starring in ‘Pan’.

Young actor Levi Miller, best known for starring in sci-fi series ‘Terra Nova’, has been tapped in to play Peter Pan in Joe Wright’s ‘Pan’.

The actor has joined Hugh Jackman, who will play the the pirate Blackbeard and Garrett Hedlund, who has been tapped to play Captain Hook, reported Variety.

The film will be a new take on the classic story. It is set during WWII and follows an orphan who is kidnapped by pirates and brought to Neverland, where he discovers he’s destined to save the land from the pirate Blackbeard.

In the Warner Bros film, Rooney Mara has been attached to take on the role of Native American princess Tiger Lily, and Adeel Akhtar is tapped to play Smee, Hook’s right-hand man.

item.title: Chris Martin joins ‘The Voice’ as mentor
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The singer will be a guest mentor for the second round of battles.
item.content:encoded:
Chris Martin will act as a “universal advisor” to the rest of the coaches. (Reuters)

Coldplay frontman Chris Martin has joined singing reality show ‘The Voice’ as a mentor in the
new format.

The 37-year-old singer will be a guest mentor for the second round of battles, and will act as a “universal advisor” to the rest of the coaches, the Hollywood Reporter said. He will also aid all of the show’s contenders during ’Battle Rounds: Round 2,’ which commences from March 31.

The new format will have each contestant paired up and then sing the same song separately in a sudden-death match. The knockout stage was almost leaked weeks ago at a ’Voice’ screening in New York City, hosted by executive producer Mark Burnett, host Carson Daly and mentor Usher.

“Every season, we do reserve the right to look back and say, how do we tweak this show to keep what’s important, authentic music and the highest level on talent onscreen, with
four of the biggest people in music? And with that do come some tweaks. There might be some surprises this year,” Daly said.

Apart from appearing on the March 31st episode, Martin will also feature on the NBC show on April 1st and April 7st.

media:content.media:title: Chris Martin will act as a "universal advisor" to the rest of the coaches. (Reuters)

item.title: Jennifer Lopez’s tenth album gets June 17 release date

item.content:encoded:
Jennifer Lopez’s new project will feature guest appearances from Tyga, Big Sean and Maxwell. (AP Photo)

Songstress Jennifer Lopez has finally set the release date of her highly-anticipated new album.

The 44-year-old singer said that her tenth studio effort would arrive on June 17, reported Ace Showbiz. ”We’re in the final stages of putting it together. I think I have to turn it in like next week,” Lopez said.

When asked about the title for the record, she said that she would wait “until the last minute” to decide. Lopez’s new project will feature guest appearances from Tyga, Big Sean and Maxwell.

“There’s just so much amazing stuff on this album. I’m so excited for people to hear it,” the ‘American Idol’ judge explained.

item.title: ‘Lakshmi’ will get limited release: Nagesh Kukunoor
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: "The box office cannot be the reason to make a film because if you start like that you only make crap," Kukunoor said.
item.content:encoded:
“It should make sense with respect to its budget because the producers and distributors only look at that. The box office cannot be the reason to make a film because if you start like that you only make crap,” Kukunoor, 46, said.

Filmmaker Nagesh Kukunoor says he is anticipating “limited release” for his film ‘Lakshmi’, which is based on human trafficking.

“It should make sense with respect to its budget because the producers and distributors only look at that. The box office cannot be the reason to make a film because if you start like that you only make crap,” Kukunoor, 46, said.

The film starring Kukunoor as a pimp is releasing this Friday. Other cast in the film includes Shefali Shah, Ram Kapoor and Satish Kaushik.

“A film like ‘Lakshmi’ will get a limited release. It is not like we will release such a film with 2,000 prints. It would maximum be 300 prints. But the question now is which weekend do you catch and within that what kind of shows you get,” Kukunoor said, when asked on whether the box office response has become the sole parameter even for non-commercial films like ‘The Lunch Box’, ‘Ship of Theseus’ and others.

“That is a challenge. If a film has to work it will work if it doesn’t have to it won’t, no matter what you do it will not work,” he added.

‘Lakshmi’ is a tale of a gritty 13-year-old girl who rises from the cesspit of trafficking and prostitution. The idea for this film came to Kukunoor from the NGO he supports. The NGO rescues and rehabilitates children who are pushed into flesh trade.

Playback singer Monali Thakur is playing the protagonist in the film.

Kukunoor spotted Thakur at a party and finalised her for the role. ‘Lakshmi’ was screened at events like the Palm Springs International Film Festival and Melbourne Indian Film Festival among others. “I am happy with the response it got,” he added.

media:content.media:title: "It should make sense with respect to its budget because the producers and distributors only look at that. The box office cannot be the reason to make a film because if you start like that you only make crap," Kukunoor, 46, said.

item.title: Coming out as gay didn’t make life easy for George Michael
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The singer says he faced a troubled life since coming out.
item.content:encoded:
George Michael feels the media destroyed the popularity he had among his straight audience. (Reuters)

British singer George Michael says his coming out as gay in 1998 following an arrest did not help make his life easy.

The singer’s fans came to know that he was gay following his arrest for “lewd behavior” in a park in Beverly Hills. ”For some strange reason, my gay life didn’t get easier when I came out. Quite the opposite happened, really,” Michael told BBC in an interview.

Michael, who has had a troubled life since coming out, feels the media destroyed the popularity he had among his straight audience.

“… I think some men were frustrated that their girlfriends wouldn’t let go of the idea that George Michael just hadn’t found the ‘right girl’. Which is still what a lot of my extended family still think!”

media:content.media:title: George Michael feels the media destroyed the popularity he had among his straight audience. (Reuters)

The couple were photographed out and about during their first trip together to the country amid rumours that they were dating, reported People magazine.

George Clooney has reportedly taken his new girlfriend, British lawyer Amal Alamuddin, to Tanzania for a wildlife safari.

The couple were photographed out and about during their first trip together to the country amid rumours that they were dating, reported People magazine.

They were first spotted together in October but rumours of a romance gained momentum when they turned up together for a special screening of ‘The Monuments Men’ at the White House.

item.title: Keira Knightley’s wedding dress splattered in red wine
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: Keira married husband James Righton in a Chanel dress that she had owned for sometime but is not troubled that she might not be able to wear it again.
item.content:encoded:
The 28-year-old actress married husband James Righton in a Chanel dress that she had owned for sometime but is not troubled that she might not be able to wear it again, reported the Telegraph.

Keira Knightley, who surprised by opting for an old dress to get married instead of picking up a designer gown, says her beloved dress is now splattered with red wine.

The 28-year-old actress married husband James Righton in a Chanel dress that she had owned for sometime but is not troubled that she might not be able to wear it again, reported the Telegraph.

“It’s now got red wine spilled down the front because the last time I wore it my friend (knocked my arm) and now it’s everywhere. I didn’t quite realize the extent of it until I got home. It’s quite impressively splattered.

“But, hey, a good night is a good night and when a dress has had its time, maybe it’s had its time. I’m pretty sure I can get it out but, if I can’t, I’m happy with the memory of a good night and the story of how the dress got destroyed,” Knightley said.

The actress was photographed wearing the prom princess dress on a number of occasions before and after her marriage and Knightley says she opted to marry in the outfit because it carried good memories.

“I’d worn the dress lots. It was my something old. And I liked not making a big deal about it. I just wanted to be in something I had had a great time in, something I would have a great time in again,” explained Knightley, who is the face of Chanel.

Another favourite item that the star can be spotted sporting in dungarees as she finds them super comfortable since childhood. Knightley said she owns three pairs of dungarees.

media:content.media:title: The 28-year-old actress married husband James Righton in a Chanel dress that she had owned for sometime but is not troubled that she might not be able to wear it again, reported the Telegraph.

item.title: Sanjay Mishra on why he takes up every role that comes his way
item.dc:creator: swatichandra2014
item.description: Ahead of his next release, Ankhon Dekhi, Sanjay Mishra talks about disillusionment with education, stumbling into acting and why he takes up every role that comes his way.
item.content:encoded:
Sanjay Mishra; (above) a still from Ankhon Dekhi.

A pressure cooker, a cooking gas, pans and ladles, spices, a camera and an elaborate music system — a peep into the boot of Sanjay Mishra’s car can surprise those who don’t know the actor well. And those who do, will say he’s as passionate about cooking as he is about acting. “For shoots that are a few hours’ drive, I leave ahead of schedule to stop at a picturesque spot, rustle up a meal and click pictures. I did that last month in Fiji too, where fresh catch was easily available,” says Mishra.

When we meet at Film City, Mishra’s left his portable kitchen behind but food is still on his mind. The actor offers to order fish from a popular restaurant nearby. Then, signalling his make-up man to start applying a fake beard for the film he is shooting for, Mishra switches topics to talk about his next, Rajat Kapoor-directed Ankhon Dekhi, which releases on March 21.

Set in a part of Delhi that still retains an old-world charm, Ankhon Dekhi revolves around Babuji’s (played by Mishra) decision — triggered by a family problem — to believe only in what he has either seen or experienced himself. For instance, his need to see a tiger growl before using the Hindi proverb ‘Sher ki tarah dahadhna’. How this pans out for him and the household, which comprises his brother’s family apart from his own — with constant visitors that include nosy neighbours — forms the crux of
the story.

“This drastic decision by Babuji is driven by what’s happening in his daughter’s life. Babuji has probably been a perceptive, sensitive man; he doesn’t appear to be one who goes about his life and work mechanically. That’s what I gathered from the character when I saw the film a few weeks ago,” says Mishra.

For an actor who pretty much carries the film on his shoulders, Mishra’s response makes one wonder why he doesn’t seem sure of his character’s intentions. Rolling a cigarette, he considers the question for a few seconds before explaining that he doesn’t believe an actor can know his character better than the director. “In the early days of my career, I was part of the TV show Chanakya. To prepare for the role, I would read the script thrice a day and work on my character. But on the first day of shoot I realised the image I had conjured of my character was nothing close to what the director wanted. Ever since, I let the director lead me close to his vision and play it out the way he wants it,” he says.

Now, he also responds to the character based on how an audience would view it. To do so, he uses “clues” such as the setting of the scene and the mindset of other characters. For instance, Kapoor’s vision of Babuji that he had gathered from the script became clearer when he saw the house the family lived in, the kind of neighbours they had, and the clothes they wore. He then tried to breathe life into it, improvising the script to make Babuji fit into that kind of a setting.However, Mishra isn’t entirely unlike Babuji. Much like the character who refuses to believe in mathematical theory that parallel lines can meet at infinity “because no one’s seen it happen”, he questioned everything taught in the formal education system during his early years in Varanasi and Delhi. “If education couldn’t answer my questions — Did Emperor Akbar go to bed in such finery every day? Did he have a sense of humour? — I didn’t want it,” he says.
This, in a way, led him to join the National School of Drama (NSD) in Delhi. Upset by his performance in school, Mishra’s journalist father wanted him to take up any job, even that of a peon. But his father’s friend, noted Hindi writer Manohar Shyam Joshi, saw his horoscope and suggested that he go to a drama school instead.

However, Mishra was reluctant. It meant “another three years of schooling. I loved acting because it helped me connect with people even if I didn’t know them. I didn’t want it to come with the burden of being my profession,” he says. But while at NSD, he had an enriching time as he discovered international cinema, and learnt from his roommate Tigmanshu Dhulia and his senior Irrfan, among others.

Yet, Mishra —  who has been critically lauded for his roles in Golmaal Returns, Jolly LLB, and Phas Gaye Re Obama among others — insists he doesn’t take acting too seriously, pointing to his filmography. “I am often asked why I do all kinds of roles and films, especially the ones I know may never release. But acting’s to me is a way of life that also earns me my bread and butter. Films are also my way of rehearsing — I can do that in front of a mirror but I prefer it with a script. I have reached where I am by doing all those films; for instance, I got my next with Yash Raj Films because they saw me in Ankhon Dekhi when it still didn’t have a distributor or a release date.”

media:content.media:title: Sanjay Mishra; (above) a still from Ankhon Dekhi.

item.title: I want to shed my bold avatar post Ragini MMS 2, says Sunny Leone
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Sunny Leone said, “I now want to explore the actor within me."
item.content:encoded:
Sunny Leone said, “I now want to explore the actor within me.”

Adult film star Sunny Leone wants to shed her bold avatar and focus on doing movies that will get her noticed as an actress.

With her choice of films like ‘Jism 2′ and ‘Ragini MMS 2′ Sunny Leone has been tagged as a bold actress and now she wants to change that image.

“I am ecstatic at the response that my songs and scenes from ‘Ragini MMS 2′ have received. While I loved doing all of this, I now want to explore the actor within me,” Sunny said.

The 32-year-old said that ‘Ragini MMS 2′ will be her last erotica in Bollywood as she wants to take a break from ‘horrex’ (horror and sex) movies.

“Sex and horror is a lethal combination. They are proven sellers. When oomph is combined with horror, it creates an entirely new experience for fans of the genre,” Tanuj Garg, CEO, Balaji Motion Pictures said.

Directed by Bhushan Patel and produced by Ekta Kapoor, ‘Ragini MMS 2′ releases on March 21.

item.title: Shahid Kapoor completes ‘Haider’ shoot
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Shahid Kapoor said he is filming rest of the movie with three layers of woolen clothing in Mumbai's heat!
item.content:encoded:
Shahid Kapoor said he is filming rest of the movie with three layers of woolen clothing in Mumbai’s heat!

Bollywood actor Shahid Kapoor, who has collaborated with filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj for ‘Haider’, is all set to complete the shooting for the film.

Shahid Kapoor had earlier today (March 19) tweeted, “Last day on HAIDER sets today . Been an amazing journey . Thankful for the experience . Morning all .. Keep it real .. make every day count.”

The actor, who had finished the Kashmir shooting schedule in February, is filming rest of the movie in Mumbai with three layers of woolen clothing!

The actor tweets, “Shooting in 3 layers of woolen clothing in the lovely heat !! Ending it hot n sweaty #haider.”

Shahid Kapoor, recently made headline after he had gone bald for the film, which is adaptation of Shakespeare tragedy play ‘Hamlet’.

The film also stars Shraddha Kapoor, Irrfan Khan and Tabu in pivotal roles.

item.title: Shruti Haasan’s ‘heavy metal Maharashtrian’ gig for ‘Gabbar’
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Shruti Haasan was spotted dressed as a Maharastrian mulgi giving a funky beat on the drums.
item.content:encoded:
Shruti Haasan was spotted dressed as a Maharastrian mulgi giving a funky beat on the drums.

Actress-model Shruti Haasan is back in Mumbai to shoot for Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s ‘Gabbar’ opposite Akshay Kumar.

The actress, who is simulataneously shooting for Anees Bazmee’s ‘Welcome Back’ in Dubai, tweeted, “Heading back to mumbai for the shoot of gabbar! Excited :)”

Shruti Haasan, who has also donned the hat of a singer for several films including ‘Unnaipol Oruvan’, ‘Chachi 420′, posted an image on Instagram dressed as a Maharastrian mulgi giving a funky beat on the drums. Shruti captioned the image, “Heavy metal maharashtrian mami!!!”

Shruti Haasan is also the vocalist of an alternative rock band ‘The Extramentals’!

Meanwhile, Bollywood actress Kareena Kapoor Khan is also about shoot an item song for Sanjay Leela Bhansali.

‘Gabbar’, which also stars Prakash Raj, Sonu Sood, Nikitin Dheer and Govind Namdev is slated to release in January , next year.

item.title: ‘O Teri’ to have references of CWG scam, Suresh Kalmadi ?
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Atul Agnihotri's upcoming film 'O Teri' is reportedly inspired by of Common Wealth Games scam.
item.content:encoded:
Atul Agnihotri’s upcoming film ‘O Teri’ is reportedly inspired by of Common Wealth Games scam.

Atul Agnihotri’s upcoming film ‘O Teri’ is reportedly inspired by of Common Wealth Games scam.

Produced by Atul and presented by Salman Khan, the film revolves around Prantabh Pratap and Anand Ishvaram Devadutt Subramanium who are journalists doing regular stories, facing ordinary pressures of life when a quirky turn of events changes their lives.

According to sources, the character played by Anupam Kher in the film is based on CWG’s former organising committee chairman Suresh Kalmadi, who was accused of irregularities in the preparations for the 2010 Games.

When asked, director Umesh Bist said, “The film is inspired by real life events but I would not like to reveal anything as of now.”

The film, starring Pulkit Samrat and Bilal Amrohi, is a comedy with funny take on a lot of real life events.

It is slated to release on 28 March.

item.title: Miley Cyrus’ tour bus bursts into flames
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Miley Cyrus' tour bus caught fire and burst into flames while her sister and mother were still inside.
item.content:encoded:
Miley Cyrus’ tour bus caught fire and burst into flames while her sister and mother were still inside.

Pop star Miley Cyrus’ tour bus caught fire and burst into flames while her sister and mother were still inside, but everyone managed to escape unharmed.

The 21-year-old ‘Wrecking Ball’ hitmaker’s convoy caught fire after one of its tires blew, reported MTV online.

The incident happened in New Orleans but luckily Miley was still in her hotel room when the vehicle set alight.

However, Miley’s close family members were inside the vehicle, but they all managed to escape in time.

Miley’ younger sister Noah posted a video of the aftermath of the fire on her Instagram account, which shows the entire bus engulfed in flames on the roadside.

The incident happened in New Orleans but luckily Miley was still in her hotel room when the vehicle set alight. (Photo: Instagram)

The vehicle belonged to Miley’s mother, Trish.

The exact location of the incident is still unknown.

The tour itself has garnered controversy for Miley’s provocative style and sexually charged performances.

item.title: Ayushmann Khurrana’s father to make small screen debut
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Ayushmann Khurrana's astrologer father P Khurana is all set to make his debut on small screen.
item.content:encoded:
Ayushmann Khurrana’s astrologer father P Khurana is all set to make his debut on small screen.

Ayushmann Khurrana’s astrologer father P Khurana is all set to make his debut on small screen with reality show ‘Welcome 2 – Baazi Mehman Nawaazi Ki’.

The second season of the unique reality show, adapted from British show ‘Come Dine With Me’, will explore the Delhi cuisine and culture this time.

Ayushmann’s father is one of the contestants on the Life OK’s show and in the coming weeks he will be seen bonding with other contestants over food, entertainment and hospitality.

The contestants will mark each other on the basis of their three course meal and the entertainment factor.

With no host in the second season, the show will focus on the concept of common man and his tryst with the food.

item.title: Ali Fazal to fly to Abu Dhabi to join ‘Fast & Furious 7′ gang
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: 'Fast & Furious 7' was postponed after Paul Walker's death in a car crash in Washington.
item.content:encoded:
‘Fast & Furious 7′ was postponed after Paul Walker’s death in a car crash in Washington.

The sudden demise of Paul Walker had put a question mark on the future of Fast & Furious 7. However the makers have decided to commence the shooting of the film, which had been postponed after Paul Walker’s death in a car crash in Washington, in Abu Dhabi.

Bollywood actor Ali Fazal, who is all set to be part of the thrilling saga says happily, “Yes, I will be joining the Fast & Furious gang soon. We have to finish the filming.”

Though the dates have not been sent to Ali Fazal, he has been told to keep himself ready to leave for Abu Dhabi at the end of this month. The shooting of ‘Fast & Furious 7′ resumes in the first week of April.

Ali Fazal also plays the romantic lead opposite Vidya Balan in ‘Bobby Jasoos’. Since he would be required in Mumbai for promoting the film which is expected to release around June (date not yet firmed in) he is hoping that the shooting schedules of ‘Fast & Furious 7′ don’t clash with his promotion of ‘Bobby Jasoos’.

item.title: Ashton Kutcher asks for Mila Kunis’ father’s blessings
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: Ashton Kutcher wanted to take a traditional approach and decided to have a chat with his girlfriend's father.
item.content:encoded:
Ashton Kutcher wanted to take a traditional approach and decided to have a chat with his girlfriend’s father.

Actor Ashton Kutcher has gone the traditional way in marriage by seeking blessing from girlfriend Mila Kunis’ father.

The 36-year-old ‘Jobs’ actor wanted to take a traditional approach and decided to have a chat with his girlfriend’s father, Mark, over the Christmas period before he popped the big question, reported People magazine.

“He talked with Mila’s dad around Christmas time. He asked for Mark’s blessing to marry her. It was important to Ashton to be respectful and traditional. This is the real thing for him and he wants to do it all right,” said a source.

The former ‘That 70s Show’ co-stars have been dating since April 2012. Their friends believe they will tie the knot later this year as they “don’t want to wait.”

“They don’t want to wait. This relationship started on solid ground and everything is working out. They are in it for the long haul, truly,” one of their friends said.

Ashton Kutcher was previously married to Demi Moore and their divorce was finalised in November 2013.

media:content.media:title: Ashton Kutcher wanted to take a traditional approach and decided to have a chat with his girlfriend's father.

item.title: George Michael embarrassed by his 80′s look
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: The 'Faith' hitmaker, who shot to fame alongside Andrew Ridgeley as a member of Wham, said he finds his look weird when he looks back at old videos on Youtube.
item.content:encoded:
The ‘Faith’ hitmaker, who shot to fame alongside Andrew Ridgeley as a member of Wham, said he finds his look weird when he looks back at old videos on Youtube,

Singer George Michael has revealed that he is embarrassed by the dyed hair and hoop earrings he used to wear when he was a member of Wham.

The ‘Faith’ hitmaker, who shot to fame alongside Andrew Ridgeley as a member of Wham, said he finds his look weird when he looks back at old videos on Youtube, reported Contactmusic.

“Where do I start? I know – the blonde hair from my Wham! days. That came about because I didn’t really want to be me, so the short, dark, curly hair had to go. And I could have done without those curtain rings in my ears as well,” he said.

The 50-year-old star also regrets trying out weird ways to alter is looks.

“I do remember another embarrassing moment from the old days… when Andrew and I went to a music awards ceremony early in our career. I was wearing a suit that made me look a
bit like Colonel Sanders and I was practically orange from overdoing it on a sunbed,” he added.

media:content.media:title: The 'Faith' hitmaker, who shot to fame alongside Andrew Ridgeley as a member of Wham, said he finds his look weird when he looks back at old videos on Youtube,

item.title: Kate Winslet too busy with baby to watch weight
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: The actress debuted a stunning post-baby body while getting her star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame ceremony recently.
item.content:encoded:
The actress debuted a stunning post-baby body while getting her star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame ceremony recently.

Actress Kate Winslet, who was back filming ‘Divergent’ just six weeks after giving birth to son Bear, says she was too busy with the new born to worry about losing the pregnancy weight.

Winslet, who welcomed her son on December 7, says she has rather been eating right to feed her child properly, reported E! News.

The actress debuted a stunning post-baby body while getting her star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame ceremony recently.

“…after having a baby you end up being so busy with the baby and the nursing. And I have two other children as well obviously, so there’s so much going on that the difficulty I find is remembering that you have to eat.

“Because when you’re nursing you really have to eat, otherwise you don’t produce anything that’s going to feed your child. So nursing’s a great excuse to eat heaps. That’s what I’ve been doing.”

The 38-year-old actress, however, admits that she freaked out a bit when producers asked her to come back for some re-shoots.

“When Bear, my son, was 6 weeks old, they said, ‘We need you. We have a few days of reshoots to do.’ And I said, ‘Are you high?!’ Like, how am I going to do this? But somehow you do. You just make it work. There’s actually something empowering about going, ‘Hey, I can do this! I can do all of this!’”

media:content.media:title: The actress debuted a stunning post-baby body while getting her star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame ceremony recently.

item.title: ‘Yeh hai Bakrapur’ has nothing to do with Shah Rukh Khan: Director
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: 'Yeh Hai Bakrapur' has a goat named Shah Rukh as a protagonist.
item.content:encoded:
‘Yeh Hai Bakrapur’ has a goat named Shah Rukh as a protagonist.

National award-winning filmmaker Janaki Vishwanathan’s maiden Hindi movie ‘Yeh Hai Bakrapur’ which has a goat named Shah Rukh as a protagonist is slated for April 25 release.

The official trailer of the film has, however, triggered strong reactions from some fans of the Bollywood superstar on micro-blogging site ‘Twitter’.

“We were trending on the date of the official release on March 3 and it was a major hungama on Twitter but honestly the film has nothing to do with Shah Rukh Khan. I was busy with the promos and it was only later I came across the responses,” Vishwanathan told PTI.

A fan had posted the message ‘shame on you’ on her Twitter account and another ‘using name ‘ SRK’ for getting publicity for your film!!! shame on you.’

“Look the goat is named just Shah Rukh. Somehow the fans have got the impression that the film is to mock SRK, but once they come and see it, I feel they will understand,” she said.

Vishwanathan said she has great respect for Shah Rukh Khan and what he has achieved and reiterated the film is not an attempt to poke fun at him.

Asked if the 47-year-old actor has reacted, she said, “We are trying to get in touch with him. I am confident he will appreciate the subject and extend good wishes for the movie.”

Vishwanathan said they planned to screen it at 500 theatres nationwide. The first copy of the movie was ready before the Mumbai film fest in late October last year. She was busy shooting with a promotional song last week. This has also been incorporated, she said.

Besides the Mumbai film festival, the film was also screened at the Goteburg Fest in Sweden in January this year.

Besides the goat, the 90-minute film, scripted and directed by her, stars Anshuman Jha, Asif Basra, Faiz Khan, Shameen Khan and Suruchi Aulakh.
The film is said to be a social-political satire set against the backdrop of rural India. “It dwells, at the primary level, on the relationship between eight-year-old Zulfi and his pet goat Shah Rukh.”

The official trailer has received over a million hits since its launch. “Mind you, it has no superstars,” she said.

The movie was shot on the Karnataka-Maharashtra border and the goat bought from Bidar. As for ‘Shah Rukh’, she said it has been donated to the Veterinary University at Madhavaram near Chennai.

“He is being looked after by the University and will spend the rest of his days there,” Vishwanathan said when asked if it will end up in a slaughter house.

“As part of promotional strategy, we have just launched an android mobile game called Kaun Banega PM. There is a live scoreboard on our website and social media
properties,” she said.

Earlier, they had named the film ‘Bakrapur’ but when they approached the Producers’ Council for registration of the title, it was suggested they add a prefix or suffix to it as somebody else had submitted a project named ‘Bakra’, she said.

The journalist-turned-filmmaker’s first film ‘Kutty’ released in 2001 fetched her two National awards. She did ‘Kanavu Mei Pada Vaendum’ in 2004 and then ‘Om Obama’ in 2011.

The music of ‘Bakrapur’ has been composed by ‘Agnee’, a Mumbai-based rock band.

item.title: Vidya Balan, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan no place for a pregnant actress in Bollywood?
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Pregnancy is turning out to be a bane rather than boon in showbiz.
item.content:encoded:
Pregnancy is turning out to be a bane rather than boon in showbiz.

Pregnancy is turning out to be a bane rather than boon in Bollywood. After the infamous fallout of Madhur Bhandarkar-Aishwarya Rai Bachchan in 2011, there are reports that director Sujoy Ghosh has also replaced his favourite actress Vidya Balan with Kangana Ranaut in his upcoming film ‘Durga Rani Singh’.

Vidya Balan at a press meet for Indian Film Festival of Melbourne.

Sujoy Ghosh, who has worked with Vidya Balan in ‘Kahaani’, is now all set to roll out his next film titled ‘Durga Rani Singh’ with Bollywood’s ‘Queen’ Kangana.

Also Read: Has Sujoy Ghosh signed Kangna Ranaut for ‘Durga Rani Singh’

Everyone expected Sujoy Ghosh to sign his ‘Kahaani’ star, however according to reports, Sujoy has replaced Vidya Balan because of her rumoured pregnancy. Vidya Balan has been spotted frequently at a suburban hospital and if reports are to be believed she has been consulting a doctor on regular basis. But the hospital staff has been asked not to divulge any details about her visit.

Vidya Balan was also spotted wearing relatively loose fitted maxi dresses for the promotions of her last release ‘Shaadi Ke Side Effects’.

Vidya Balan, who married UTV’s head honcho Sidharth Roy Kapur in 2012, was also spotted wearing relatively loose fitted maxi dresses for the promotions of her last release ‘Shaadi Ke Side Effects’. Her choice of outfits raised the suspicion whether the actress was trying to hide an apparent baby bump.

Also Read: What’s the reason for Vidya Balan’s secret visits to doctor?

Vidya Balan recently wrapped up the shoot of Dia Mirza’s debut production ‘Bobby Jasoos’ and has no other films in hand at the moment.

Vidya Balan at the screening of ‘Shaadi Ke Side effects’.

This recent case has reignited the issue of no pregnancy clause in Bollywood. While many Bollywood veterans believe that the clause is valid some believe otherwise.

In an interview to Mid-Day, veteran actress Hema Malini said, “Today the no pregnancy clause should be made mandatory, but only for a certain time period, say a maximum of six months. If the artiste gets pregnant before the film goes on the floors, she should inform the producer. But if the film gets delayed for other reasons, then it’s wrong to expect the actress to wait. She can’t be held responsible in such a situation.”

While Hema Malini took a midway, producer Ramesh Taurani says that it’s alright for an actress to give importance to her personal life. “At the end of the day, it is just about a film and I don’t think it’s a big deal. If a film hasn’t gone on the floors, the question of monetary loss does not arise at all.”

In 2011, Madhur Bhandarkar had said that he incurred a loss of Rs 4 crore because ‘the truth was hidden’. He even hinted that he would not have started the film had he known about her pregnancy. He also wrote on his blog, “The entire event would not have taken place if on the onset the actress would have informed the state of her health an impending maternity… We learnt about the entire thing from news channels like the rest of the world that the said actress was 4-month pregnant and she was due in November.”

Meanwhile cases of prejudice against pregnant actresses is not only an issue in Bollywood. Actress Halle Berry’s role in the upcoming ‘X-Men: Days of Future Past’ movie has been reportedly cut down.

The 47-year-old actress’ presence in the film as mutant Storm has allegedly been cut down to just one scene. Halle Berry was pregnant with her second child during most of the filming on ‘X-Men: Days of Future Past’ in Montreal. The film will be released in cinemas on May 2. (With PTI inputs)

item.title: We don’t need any reality show to prove our love: Gauahar Khan
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: Gauahar Khan might have expressed her love for actor Kushal Tandon on a reality show but the actress now wants to keep her relationship private.
item.content:encoded:
The 30-year-old actress, who will again be seen with Kushal in upcoming TV show ‘Khatron Ke Khiladi’ after their stint in ‘Bigg Boss’, says she does not need any reality show to keep their relationship going.

Gauahar Khan might have expressed her love for actor Kushal Tandon on a reality show but the actress now wants to keep her relationship private.

The 30-year-old actress, who will again be seen with Kushal in upcoming TV show ‘Khatron Ke Khiladi’ after their stint in ‘Bigg Boss’, says she does not need any reality show to keep their relationship going.

“We had expressed our love for each other on a reality show but now it has become very personal. We don’t need any reality show again to prove how much we love each other. Joining the same show together was just a coincidence. It’s not a medium to keep our relationship going. I am just loving the whole idea of being in love,” Gauahar told PTI.

The couple met on ‘Bigg Boss’ and love blossomed between the two on show, which Gauahar won.

The ‘Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year’ actress says she is happy with the way Kushal brings the best in her and helped her on the Colors’ stunt-dare reality show.

“Kushal is one of the best human beings I have ever met. He backs me up whenever I need him and at the same time he keeps me pushing till I achieve the goal, He helps me to bring out the best in me,” Gauahar said.

The fifth season of ‘Khatron Ke Khiladi’ will be hosted by filmmaker Rohit Shetty and will have celebrities like Dayanand Shetty, Salman Yusuff Khan, Mugdha Godse, Ranvir Shorey among others. The show will be on air from March 22.

Gauahar says Rohit is the show’s best host, which is based on the American ‘Fear Factor’.  “I took part in the show to overcome every possible fear in my life. And when I heard that Rohit (Shetty) is hosting the show, I grabbed the offer. I feel he is the best host till now. He is encouraging and very big factor for all of us on the show to complete all the task,” she said.

Apart from her small screen commitments, the actress is all geared up to release her first film, whose last set of schedule she will shot soon.

media:content.media:title: The 30-year-old actress, who will again be seen with Kushal in upcoming TV show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' after their stint in 'Bigg Boss', says she does not need any reality show to keep their relationship going.

item.title: Shruti Haasan avoids Shiney Ahuja, director Anees Bazmee adamant on having him in ‘Welcome Back’
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: "Anees has made it very clear to Shruti that signing Shiney was his idea," said a source.
item.content:encoded:
According to reports, Shruti Haasan keeps her distance from the actor.

Shiney Ahuja, who has flown off to Dubai to join the cast and crew of Anees Bazmee’s ‘Welcome Back’, has found whole-hearted acceptance in the unit. Everyone except the film’s leading lady Shruti Haasan has welcomed Shiney with enthusiasm.

According to reports, Shruti Haasan keeps her distance from the actor.

Says a source from Dubai, “Anees has made it very clear to Shruti that signing Shiney was his idea. And no one has the right to object. There is some friction between Anees and Shruti over this issue. But he has decided to stand his ground.”

Speaking from Dubai, Anees Bazmee said: “Initially there was skepticism about Shiney’s presence. But I was very clear about what I was doing. Whether Shiney is guilty or not of the crime he was accused of, we’ve no right to pass judgment on him. Let the law take its course.”

Anees is adamant about giving the actor work to do. “Shiney has every right to work. He has a wife, daughter and parents to support. His father broke down when he called me to thank me for giving Shiney work. No one from the film industry was willing to give him work, not even Shiney’s so-called friends.”

Apparently, Anees has been receiving threats from elements both within and outside the film industry after the announcement of Shiney Ahuja’s presence in ‘Welcome Back’.

“I am not scared of anything. There are people who are unhappy that he is working in my film. Let them do what they like. Now that Shiney Ahuja has shot with me I am even more convinced it was the right decision. He plays a rich spoilt man. This is the first time he will be seen in a comic avatar,” said Anees.

Shiney plays Naseeruddin Shah’s wayward son. They are both cast as gangsters. Naseer will apparently be shown reprimanding Shiney for his errant ways.

media:content.media:title: According to reports, Shruti Haasan keeps her distance from the actor.

item.title: Mick Jagger on L’Wren Scott’s death: I am still struggling to understand how my lover and best friend could end her life
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: "I am still struggling to understand how my lover and best friend could end her life in this tragic way,” said Mick Jagger.
item.content:encoded:
“I am still struggling to understand how my lover and best friend could end her life in this tragic way,” said Mick Jagger.

Rolling Stones star Mick Jagger has released a heartfelt tribute following the death of his designer girlfriend L’Wren Scott.

The designer was found dead by her assistant on March 17 of apparent suicide. Jagger, who was in Australia when she died, released a statement on Facebook, reported Ace Showbiz.

“I am still struggling to understand how my lover and best friend could end her life in this tragic way. We spent many wonderful years together and had made a great life for ourselves. We spent many wonderful years together and had made a great life for ourselves,” Jagger, 70, wrote.

“I have been touched by the tributes that people have paid to her, and also the personal messages of support that I have received. I will never forget her.”

Previously, a representative for Jagger said that the rocker was “completely shocked and devastated by the news.”

The Rolling Stones’ seven-date tour in Australia and New Zealand has been postponed “as a result of the death of L’Wren Scott.”

Jagger’s model daughter Georgia May Jagger also cancelled her appearance in a modelling gig in Melbourne following the sad news. She reportedly headed back to the US to be with her family.

item.title: Tabla has fit in this time and generation: Zakir Hussain
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: "If you watch television, Hollywood movies or Bollywood movies, then the background score that you hear is of the tabla," he said.
item.content:encoded:
“Tabla is one of those rare blessed instrument that has fit in this time and with this generation. It is one of the most loved and desired percussion instruments anywhere in the globe,” Ustad Zakir Hussain told PTI in an interview. (PTI)

Tabla is one of those rare musical instruments that has maintained its universal appeal even in this age, said eminent table player Ustad Zakir Hussain, who kicks off his Masters of Percussion series of performances across North America this week.

“Tabla is one of those rare blessed instrument that has fit in this time and with this generation. It is one of the most loved and desired percussion instruments anywhere in the globe,” Ustad Zakir Hussain told PTI in an interview.

“If you watch television, Hollywood movies or Bollywood movies, then the background score that you hear is of the tabla… there is not a single movie I know that does not have a sound of tabla in it,” he said.

Tabla, he argued, has become a rhythm instrument of choice for a lot of composers, for lot of remix artists, for DJs, for rappers, hip-hop people and of course for the Indian people whether it is the ghazal, qawali or a Bollywood movie.

“So it is an instrument that fits into all these genres of music and therefore it is one of the most universally loved percussion instrument in the similar way like bongo drum or a drum set have been for the last many decades,” Hussain said.

The 63-year-old musician feels that the young crop of tabla players have also contributed a lot to spread the popularity of the instrument.

“One other thing about tabla is that now we have a whole bunch of young tabla players who are really very very good. And so it becomes easier for tabla to be promoted through their talents and performances,” he said.

The Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan awardee is currently on a multi-city tour in North America called ‘Zakir Hussain and Masters of Percussion’. Beginning in Houston on March 19, the tour would take him to New York, Berkeley in California, Boston, Chicago, Toronto, Portland, Washington DC, Seattle, Charleston, Durham and Winchester.

“It is a very extensive and pretty huge tour of master of percussion this year,” he said.

Joining the tour are Selvaganesh Vinayakram (Kanjira and Ghatam), Steve Smith (Western Drums), Niladri Kumar (Sitar), Dilshad Khan, (Sarangi), Deepak Bhatt (Dhol), Vijay Chavan (Dholki). Steve Smith is the first western drummer Zakir Hussain has ever selected for Masters of Percussion.

In four cities (Houston, Berkeley, Durham, and New York) they will be joined by the distinguished Kathak dancer Antonia Minnecola. New York will also see performance by singer Hariharan.

“You know this troupe represents the interesting mix of rhythm tradition that comes from the Rajasthan region, from Punjab, from the coastal region of Maharashtra, from south
India and of course from the western world and all tied into the beautiful visual impact of it through the Kathak dance element,” the Ustad said.

media:content.media:title: "Tabla is one of those rare blessed instrument that has fit in this time and with this generation. It is one of the most loved and desired percussion instruments anywhere in the globe," Ustad Zakir Hussain told PTI in an interview. (PTI)

Rakshanda Khan tied the knot with her long term beau Sachin Tyagi on March 15.

Television actress and anchor Rakshanda Khan tied the knot with her long term beau Sachin Tyagi on March 15.

When asked if he is breaking bad in real life, he said, “You mean, cheating and living a loose life? No. I’m a good guy. I wish more people knew me.

‘Breaking Bad’ star Aaron Paul feels he doesn’t ‘deserve’ his wife, filmmaker Lauren Parsekian.

The 34-year-old actor insists he is a good guy who would never do anything to hurt his spouse, who he married last May – and is completely devoted to her, reported New York Post.

item.title: I’m disgusted with Woody Allen’s behaviour: Lena Dunham
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: Lena Dunham, 27, said that she was disgusted by the famed director, but she would not indict his works, reported Ace Showbiz.
item.content:encoded:
Lena Dunham, 27, said that she was disgusted by the famed director, but she would not indict his works, reported Ace Showbiz.

Golden Globe winner Lena Dunham has shown her support to Dylan Farrow, who accused Woody Allen of sexually abusing her.

Lena Dunham, 27, said that she was disgusted by the famed director, but she would not indict his works, reported Ace Showbiz.

“In the latest Woody Allen debate I’m decidedly pro-Dylan Farrow and decidedly disgusted with Woody Allen’s behavior… I’m not gonna indict the work. I think that you can decide that you don’t want to support the work of somebody who has molested a child.

That’s a completely appropriate choice. But going through it and saying, ‘Look, he’s told us in 57 ways that he rapes kids’ – that’s not the thing. The thing is to look at the actual evidence that exists in the world, which I think strongly suggests that Woody Allen is in the wrong. But for me the point is not to go through his one-act plays looking for references to child molestation. Because I’m not comfortable living in a world where art is part of how we convict people of crimes,” she said.

Farrow detailed the alleged sexual abuse in an open letter released in February. The ‘Blue Jasmine’ director has denied the allegations, saying that he “found the idea so ludicrous.”

media:content.media:title: Lena Dunham, 27, said that she was disgusted by the famed director, but she would not indict his works, reported Ace Showbiz.

item.title: Kareena, Kajol, Sonakshi: Bollywood divas who stole the show at LFW 2014
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: Celebrity designer Manish Malhotra opened the fashion gala this season with actress Sonakshi Sinha walked the ramp for him in a long black kurta with white embroidery.
item.content:encoded:
Celebrity designer Manish Malhotra opened the fashion gala this season with actress Sonakshi Sinha walked the ramp for him in a long black kurta with white embroidery. (Photo: Varinder Chawla)

Bollywood celebrities made their presence felt on the ramp as showstoppers for designers at the recently concluded Lakme Fashion Week. Lakme Fashion Week Summer/Resort 2014 was held from March 12-16 where 98 designers presented their collections.

Celebrity designer Manish Malhotra opened the fashion gala this season with actress Sonakshi Sinha walked the ramp for him in a long black kurta with white embroidery. (See Pics: Sonakshi Sinha opens LFW 2014)

The grand finale saw Lakme brand ambassador Kareena Kapoor Khan in a long-sleeved V-neck glittering black gown. Wearing an off white colour Kaftan with cuts on both the sides, actress Priyanka Chopra displayed confidence on the ramp in a Neeta Lulla creation on day five of LFW. (In Pics: Kareena, Priyanka at LFW Finale)

Actress Kangna Ranaut, basking in the success of her latest film ‘Queen’, was the showstopper for popular multi brand e-store Jabong.com where she made an entry in a silver sequin gown with subtle detailing. (In Pics:  Kirron Kher, Purab walk the ramp

Designer Anita Dongre ended day three of LFW with her collection called “Varanasi Weaves” which was a tribute to the traditional Indian fabrics. Actress-producer Dia Mirza glided down the catwalk in a lemon lehenga and long sleeved blouse.

Reliance Jewels presented Tarun Tahiliani’s collection on day one of LFW. Jacqueline Fernandez was his showstopper and wore a shaded orange-pink-red net kurta dupatta and decked up with magnificent necklace and earrings.

To match the sensuous yet sophisticated look of her creations, designer Jyotsna Tiwari brought on the ramp adult actress Sunny Leone in a figure hugging layered fish-tail net gown with glittering crystals. (In Pics: Sushmita Sen, Amrita Rao on the ramp)

Olympic medal winner boxer Vijender Singh walked the ramp for ace designer Archana Kochhar. Singh, who is making his acting debut with Akshay Kumar’s home production film ‘Fugly’, was joined by co-stars Kiara Advani, Mohit Marwah on the ramp.

Day five also saw actors Saqib Saleem of ‘Mere Dad Ki Maruti’ fame and Sonal Chauhan walking the ramp for designers Kunal Anil Tanna and Surya Sarkar respectively.

Actresses Karisma Kapoor and Ileana D’Cruz stepped out in lehenga for designers Arpita Mehta and Anushree Reddy on day four of LFW.  Model-actress Nargis Fakhri, who is looking forward to the release of ‘Main Tera Hero’, was seen on the runway for designer Shehla Khan.

Others like Prachi Desai, Kalki Koechlin, Amrita Puri of ‘Aisha’ and ‘Kai Po Che’ fame and Gauhar Khan ended the show for designers like Sonaakshi Raaj, Kommal Sood, Ritika Mirchandani and Ken Ferns respectively.

Sushmita Sen made heads turn in a cutwork skirt, bustier for designer Kresha Bajaj. Day four at LFW also had actors like Kirron Kher, Amrita Rao, Paoli Dam of ‘Hate Story’ fame, VJ actor Purab Kohli presenting collection of designers Gaurang Shah, Sonam-Paras Modi, Sayantan Sarkar and Lalit Sengar respectively.

Stopping the show for designer Payal Singhal was actress Neha Dhupia, model actress Lisa Haydon ended the show for designer Monica & Karishma while actor-Singer Monica Dogra was seen on ramp wearing for Veda Raheja.

Actress Richa Chadda graced the runway for designer Sounia Gohil and actor Ali Fazal of ’3 Idiots’ and ‘Fukrey’ was the showstopper for designer Digvijay Singh.

The other Bollywood personalities who attended the fashion extravaganza were Kajol, Tanisha, Ameesha Patel, Sonali Bendre, Shilpa Shetty with sister Shamita, Urmila Matondkar, Pooja Bedi, playback singer Alka Yagnik and others. (In Pics: Kajol, Neha, Malaika at LFW 2014)

item.title: Ruslaan Mumtaz, Sangeeta Ghosh’s Kehta Hai Dil Jee Le Zara to wrap up in June
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.category: Kehta Hai Dil Jee Le Zara
item.description: The introduction of several twists and turns, including the marriage track, failed to grab the eyeballs.
item.content:encoded:
The show was a comeback vehicle for television’s big stars like Sangeeta and Ruslaan.

Television show ‘Kehta Hai Dil Jee Le Zara’ starring actors Sangeeta Ghosh and Ruslaan Mumtaz will go off air soon due to lukewarm response from audience.

The show was a comeback vehicle for television’s big stars like Sangeeta and Ruslaan.

According to sources, the makers believed the duo will attract the viewers but that never happened.

Even the chemistry between the actors failed to click. The introduction of several twists and turns, including the marriage track, failed to grab the eyeballs.

The show, currently aired on Sony Entertainment Television, will most likely go off air in June, sources said.

item.title: It was difficult to watch ‘Keeping Up with Kardashians’: Khloe
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: The 29-year-old, who married professional basketball player Lamar Odom in 2009, filed for divorce in December last year amid allegations that he had cheated on her and used drugs, reported Contactmusic.
item.content:encoded:
The 29-year-old, who married professional basketball player Lamar Odom in 2009, filed for divorce in December last year amid allegations that he had cheated on her and used drugs, reported Contactmusic. (Reuters)

Reality TV star Khloe Kardashian has revealed that she found it difficult to watch ‘Keeping Up With The Kardashians’ after talking about her divorce on the show.

The 29-year-old, who married professional basketball player Lamar Odom in 2009, filed for divorce in December last year amid allegations that he had cheated on her and used drugs, reported Contactmusic.

Since her separation, Khloe has been trying to remain strong and not get affected by everything that is going on. She said she doesn’t like to watch her reality show at the moment because it is “really hard” to see her personal life laid bare to all.

“It’s definitely not anything I’m through. I’m going through it, but I’m not through it. It’s really hard to watch yourself on TV too. It’s definitely different in that the world has to watch too. It’s definitely not the easiest thing to do but it’s my life now I guess,” she said.

item.title: Sienna Miller to star in ‘American Sniper’?
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: Actress Sienna Miller is in talks to star in 'American Sniper'. The 32-year-old actress is in early negotiations to take on the lead female role, opposite Bradley Cooper, in Clint Eastwood's upcoming movie, reported Contactmusic.
item.content:encoded:
Actress Sienna Miller is in talks to star in ‘American Sniper’. The 32-year-old actress is in early negotiations to take on the lead female role, opposite Bradley Cooper, in Clint Eastwood’s upcoming movie, reported Contactmusic.

Actress Sienna Miller is in talks to star in ‘American Sniper’. The 32-year-old actress is in early negotiations to take on the lead female role, opposite Bradley Cooper, in Clint Eastwood’s upcoming movie, reported Contactmusic.

Jaimie Alexander, 30, and Evangeline Lilly, 34, were previously linked to the part, as was Kate Mara, 31, before she was snapped up for ‘Fantastic Four’.

Meanwhile, Cooper, 39, will star as Navy SEAL Chris Kyle in the film, which will follow the story of the expert marksman, who was killed by a discharged war veteran suffering from post-traumatic stress.

The film will be adapted from Kyle’s book, ‘American Sniper: The Autobiography Of The Most Lethal Sniper In US Military History’.

It is not yet known who Miller will play, but is is believed she’s landed the role of Kyle’s wife, who is left to handle their family home while her husband is away abroad. Shooting for ‘American Sniper’ is set to kick off in April.

item.title: Watch: The first trailer of ‘The Maze Runner’

item.description: The first trailer of upcoming sci-fi action film 'The Maze Runner' has been unveiled by 20th Century Fox.
item.content:encoded:
‘Teen Wolf’ actor Dylan O’Brien plays the protagonist Thomas, who wakes up trapped in a massive maze with a group of other boys and no recollection of his life before, reported Digital Spy.

The first trailer of upcoming sci-fi action film ‘The Maze Runner’ has been unveiled by 20th Century Fox.

‘Teen Wolf’ actor Dylan O’Brien plays the protagonist Thomas, who wakes up trapped in a massive maze with a group of other boys and no recollection of his life before, reported Digital Spy.

Based on the best-selling young adult novel by James Dashner, Thomas begins to piece together memories and plots to escape the confines of the vast maze, which is being used for a mysterious test.

Kaya Scodelario, Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Will Poulter and Aml Ameen also star in the film. Wes Ball will helm the project.

There are four entries in the Maze Runner series to date, with The Scorch Trials and The Death Cure serving as sequels and The Kill Order acting as a prequel. ‘The Maze Runner’ will open in cinemas on October 24.

The pair, who collaborated most recently on Iglesias’s single ‘I’m A Freak’, have teamed up for a joint US tour, which will kick off in the fall, reported Showbiz Spy.

Spanish singing sensation Enrique Iglesias and rapper Pitbull have announced that they will head out on the road together later this year.

The pair, who collaborated most recently on Iglesias’s single ‘I’m A Freak’, have teamed up for a joint US tour, which will kick off in the fall, reported Showbiz Spy.

Tour dates have yet to be announced, but the pair have released an advert confirming that tickets for the shows will be on sale soon.

“You heard right! I’m going on tour with my good friend Pitbull this fall!,” Iglesias posted on Twitter.

Asked if they had considered forming an official duo, he replied, “You know, we’ve spoken about it, seriously! We should do a whole album together – it would be amazing. We’ve toured together as well. He’s similar to me in that he doesn’t take his success for granted. We’re both enjoying where we’re at in our lives.”

item.title: Kajol on why she went from drab to fab
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Kajol is labelled as one of the most well dressed actresses in the industry today.
item.content:encoded:
Kajol is labelled as one of the most well dressed actresses in the industry today.

Bollywood actress Kajol recently appeared on chat show ‘Koffee With Karan’ for the fourth time. Being her usual fun and bubbly self, the actress chatted away with her good friend Karan Johar and director cousin Ayan Mukherji, who also graced the couch in the latest episode.

Labelled as one of the most well dressed actresses in the industry today, Kajol spoke about how she made a transition in terms of style and expressing herself through her wardrobe.

“Why have you transformed?,” asked Karan. “Suddenly you’re in the fashion pages Kajol. I thought two things wouldn’t happen, that I would make an action film which I haven’t and you being in the fashion pages is something none of us expected,” he said. “That is true,” agreed Kajol smilingly. “Even I didn’t expect it.”

“Designers want to send you their garments…Why has this happened? Apart from the pressure Manish (Malhotra) and I have put on you, there must be some real tangible reason for it,” he pushed.

“The tangible reason is just the fact that I thought of it as…I did think of it from the point of view that there is so much more focus on it today as well that was one consideration. The second consideration, the main consideration, 80% was the fact that I just felt that it’s a part of my personality that I need to develop…that I needed to pay attention to, that I needed to figure out what it was. ”

“From the age of 16, somebody has always told me what to wear and how to wear it. So I have never really had either an opinion or really cared to have an opinion on this topic. And I wanted to know what my opinion was on it.”

When asked how good she thought she was at being a fashionista, the actress said she didn’t think she was too good. “On the level of 1-10, I think I’m a 5,” she said.

item.title: Brittany Murphy’s final film to be released
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The actress passed away on December 20, 2009.
item.content:encoded:
The movie is slated to open in more theatres across the US shortly after the premiere. (Reuters)

Actress Brittany Murphy’s last film ‘Something Wicked’ will finally hit theatres four years after her death.

Murphy, 32, passed away on December 20, 2009. Her final project, which was initially supposed to release in 2011, will debut on April 4 this year at the Regal Theatre in Eugene, Oregon, the city where the movie was filmed, reported New York Daily News.

The movie is slated to open in more theatres across the US shortly after the premiere. In 2011, the film’s producer and screenwriter Joe Colleran had praised Murphy’s final role in an interview.

“Brittany pulled off one of the spookiest scenes in the movie. There’s an important scene where her character is unravelling and she spent a long time getting ready and focused and went for it. Personally, I think it’s one of the best scenes of her career,” he had said.

media:content.media:title: The movie is slated to open in more theatres across the US shortly after the premiere. (Reuters)

item.title: Veena Malik says anti-India tweets were from fake account
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: A daily reported that actress Veena Malik, of 'Bigg Boss' fame, had tweeted anti-India remarks.
item.content:encoded:
A daily reported that actress Veena Malik, of ‘Bigg Boss’ fame, had tweeted anti-India remarks.

Former actress and model Veena Malik cleared the airs about the recent anti-India tweet which raked a storm in the media over the weekend.

A daily reported that actress Veena Malik, of ‘Bigg Boss’ fame, had tweeted anti-India remarks. However, the handle used for that tweet was a fake account.

The actress, who has changed her name to ‘Veena A Khan Khattak’, after her marriage to a Dubai-based businessman in December last year, retweeted her clarification, which first appeared in an Arab daily.

After her marriage, Veena Malik had changed her twitter handle form @iVeenaMalik to @iVeenaKhan.

Fake Veena Malik tweet rakes up a storm | Arab News — Saudi Arabia News, Middle East News, Opinion, http://t.co/q3oyyXCWBg via @Arab_News

— Veena A Khan Khattak (@iVeenaKhan) March 17, 2014

Meanwhile, the fake tweet attracted a lot of negative attention for the media and the Twitter world alike. There were also reports that Veena Malik had blamed one of her ex-boyfriends for hacking into her Twitter account. Here is the tweet:

India sucks…..!!!

— Veena Malik (@iVeenaMalik) March 15, 2014

 

Veen Malik rose to fame after her stay in the controversial reality TV show ‘Bigg Boss’ and her relationship with Ashmit Patel.

item.title: Kareena Kapoor, Genelia Deshmukh host surprise dinner party for ‘Humshakals’ cast

item.content:encoded:
Kareena and Genelia surprised everyone on the sets of ‘Humshakals’ in Mauritius.

Bollywood actresses Kareena Kapoor Khan and Genelia Deshmukh recently surprised everyone on the sets of ‘Humshakals’, which stars their husband Saif Ali Khan and Riteish Deshmukh respectively with a surprise dinner party in Mauritius.

The entire cast of Humshakals have been shooting in Mauritius for quite sometime now. According to reports, Kareena and Genelia learned that their husbands were feeling home sick and immediately decided to go and visit them on the sets in Mauritius.

A source close to the team said, “It was a party time when Kareena and Genelia came on the sets. They decided to have a small get together for the entire cast and surprised everyone by throwing a seafood and salad dinner party for them. Everyone had a great time together and the party went on till late in the night.”

Produced by Fox Star Studios and Pooja Entertainment, ‘Humshakals’ also stars Ram Kapoor, Tamannaah Bhatia, Esha Gupta and Bipasha Basu. Directed by Sajid Khan, the film is all set to release June 20.

item.title: Jennifer Garner, Ben Affleck don’t want any more kids

Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck have two daughters Violet, 8, Seraphina, 5, and son Samuel 2. (Reuters)

Star couple Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck don’t want to expand their family anymore.

The 41-year-old ‘Dallas Buyers Club’ star, who raises daughters Violet, 8, Seraphina, 5, and son Samuel 2, with Affleck, 41, will not be having anymore children, she has told a friend, reported Radar online.

item.title: ‘Queen’ still going strong, beats Sonam Kapoor’s ‘Bewakoofiyaan’
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
