item.title: What do exes John Abraham, Bipasha Basu still have in common?
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Once Bollywood's hottest couple, John Abraham and Bipashu Basu have a lot in common even after their break up.
item.content:encoded:
Once Bollywood’s hottest couple, John Abraham and Bipashu Basu have a lot in common even after their break up.

Once Bollywood’s hottest couple, John Abraham and Bipashu Basu have a lot in common even after their break up.

John and Bipasha, who are both touted as the fittest actors in the tinsel town, are both fitness freaks.

While Bipasha Basu, who recently released a new fitness DVD, is always ready for more exercises, John Abraham too is relentles when it comes to burning the calories and keeping in shape.

Bipasha Basu tweeted “Starting my Sunday on a strong note!#Unleash followed by #fitandfabulousyou routine!Burrrrn !”

The actress also added, “Sunday is your day to enjoy n relax, yes!But take out an hour to workout too!Get fit n strong n look awesome!Enjoy!” She also added, “Motivate yourself on Sundays too to work out!Starting now with #Unleash and following it with…”

Meanwhile, Bipasha’s ex beau John Abraham posted a picture on Insstgram captioning it “Time for a new John Abraham !!! Fitness is religion!!!”

John Abraham and Bipasha Basu started dating during the filming of ‘Jism’ in 2003 and ended their relationship in early 2011. While John Abraham is now married to Priya Runchal, according to reports, Bipasha will soon be engaged to boyfriend Harman Baweja post the release of his film ‘Dhishkiyaoon’.

item.title: Bipasha Basu gets superstitious for ‘Creature’?
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Looks like Bollywood hottie Bipasha Basu is getting superstious about her upcoming film 'Creature'.
item.content:encoded:
Looks like Bollywood hottie Bipasha Basu is getting superstious about her upcoming film ‘Creature’.

The actress was on her way to see the final cuts for the film posted a pivture on Instagram saying “Off to meet vikram bhatt n see bits of my film #Creature !Wearing my lucky necklace The Evelyn frm @thetrunklabel!”

Bipasha Basu, who has not had a successful film for quite sometime, is collaborating with Vikram Bhatt after ‘Raaz’ for the film, which is said to based on the lines of ‘Predator’ and ‘Jurrasic Park’.

Vikram Bhatt’s ‘Creature’ will release in 3D and is touted to be India’s first creature based film. The film also marks Pakistani actor Imran Abbas Naqvi’s debut in Bollywood.

Meanwhile, Bipasha Basu is also set to feature in Sajid Khan’s ‘Humshakals’, which also stars Saif Ali Khan, Riteish Deshmukh and Ram Kapoor.

item.title: Britney Spears leaves party after panic attack?
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Britney Spears, who suffers from bipolar disorder had also shaved her head some years ago.
item.content:encoded:
Britney Spears, who suffers from bipolar disorder had also shaved her head some years ago.

Pop star Britney Spears reportedly left a party after suffering a panic attack as the overcrowded gathering made her uncomfortable.

The 32-year-old singer, who recently attended Sir Elton John’s AIDS Foundation Oscar-viewing party, made a quick exit from the event just minutes after arriving as she had apparently encountered a panic attack, reported Contactmusic.

“Britney was excited when she first went to the party but moments later she was fazed about being at such an over-crowded event,” a source said.

“She started to break out in a sweat and become short of breath, it was like she was having a panic attack ,” the source added.

Spears, who suffers from bipolar disorder had also shaved her head some years ago.

“Britney still finds large crowds nerve-wracking and doesn’t feel comfortable at showbiz events. The chaos of the red carpet and all the unfamiliar faces is very daunting, a source said.

“She manages to block out the crowd and put on an act when she’s on stage, but it’s harder when she’s socialising,” the source added.

item.title: Comedian David Brenner dies
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: David Brenner has appeared on 'The Late Show With David Letterman' and 'The Daily Show'.
item.content:encoded:
David Brenner has appeared on ‘The Late Show With David Letterman’ and ‘The Daily Show’.

Comedian David Brenner, who is said to hold the record for being the most frequent guest on ‘The Tonight Show’, has passed away at the age of 78.

Brenner died yesterday at his home in New York City, reported New York Daily News.

Born in Philadelphia, the comedian appeared on ‘The Tonight Show’ 158 times. He was a favourite of the show’s late host Johnny Carson.

The comedian was popular for his observational humour.

Brenner served two years in the Army and after majoring in mass communications at the Temple University, he went on to write, direct and produce socially-conscious TV documentaries.

He did his first paid stand-up gig in New York in June 1969. Later, when he was performing at the Greenwich Village, his agent invited the talent coordinator of ‘The Tonight Show’ to watch his client’s act.

Several auditions later, Brenner made his debut on the latenight show on January 8, 1971.

In 1976, Brenner starred in NBC’s comedy series ‘Snip’. The comedian also appeared on ‘The Ed Sullivan Show’, ‘The David Frost Show’, ‘The Mike Douglas Show’, ‘Real Time With Bill Maher’, ‘The Late Show With David Letterman’ and ‘The Daily Show’.

In addition to his sons, Brenner is survived by his wife Ruth and his grandson Wesley.

item.title: ‘Holi’ brings back ‘Raanjhanaa’ memories for Dhanush
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Dhanush tweeted, “Holi ... Raanjhanaa memories :)”
item.content:encoded:
Dhanush tweeted, “Holi … Raanjhanaa memories :)”

National Award winning actor Dhanush, who made his Bollywood debut with Aanand Rai’s ‘Raanjhanaa’ in 2013, gets nostalgic as the festival of colour approaches.

Dhanush tweeted, “Holi … Raanjhanaa memories :)”

The film had its Holi sequences set in Banaras, where Holi celebrations are at its peak. Dhanush shared some very bright Holi sequences with the film’s lead actress Sonam Kapoor.

“@aanandlrai: Raanjhanaa hua Main tera :):):) happy holi @dhanushkraja sir #raanjhanaamemories pic.twitter.com/Vu551K2eFQ”thank you sir

— Dhanush (@dhanushkraja) March 16, 2014

 

Meanwhile, ‘Dhanush’ has started shooting for his second Bollywood project with megastar Amitabh Bachchan and Kamal Haasan’s younger daughter Akshara. The film will be directed by filmmaker R Balki of ‘Paa’ fame.

Dhanush also has a project with Aanand Rai in the pipeline.

item.title: Amitabh Bachchan will not be celebrating Holi this year
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Amitabh Bachchan revealed his Holi plans on his blog on Sunday (March 16).
item.content:encoded:
Amitabh Bachchan revealed his Holi plans on his blog on Sunday (March 16).

Bollywood megastar Amitabh Bachchan revealed his Holi plans on his blog on Sunday (March 16).

While Bollywood celebrities are gearing up to play the festival of colours, holi and are wishing their fans best wishes for the festival of colours, Big B plans to go low scale on the celebrations.

Big B says that there have been certain ‘ill moments’ in the year, which still continue and therefore the celebrations will be low. Besides, Holi this year coincides with his daughter Shweta’s birthday, and therefore Amitabh Bachchan will be with her in Delhi.

Amitabh Bachchan wrote, “Holi is on the 17th .. Shweta’s Birthday and we shall be with her … so am not going to celebrate … there have been certain ill moments in the year and they still continue .. when there is mourning in the family festivals are put away, traditionally .. and so… Each year we hope that there is joy and happiness around .. and I do hope this year is one such ..”

Big B elaborated, “We do not celebrate it again … there have been discomforting news for the year, the passing away of relations distant, of long months of struggle against illness .. it would be disrespectful to be immersed in the colours of abandon and joy when some among us mourn ..”

item.title: I do not think ageless beauty exists: Sharon Stone
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Sharon Stone says she feels happy to learn that she is still thought as an attractive person.
item.content:encoded:
Sharon Stone says she feels happy to learn that she is still thought as an attractive person.

Hollywood star Sharon Stone says it is not possible for one to remain beautiful all their life as ageing is inevitable.

The 56-year-old actress feels happy to learn that she is still thought as an attractive person, reported Daily Mirror.

“I don’t think ageless beauty exists. I think it’s just a catch-phrase. And so, you know, I think that’s stupid. To be the best you can be, you know, we have to recognise that it’s an internal thing. Not just an external thing,” Stone said.

“You know, I think it’s a sense of ethics. It’s everything, you know. If you want to keep yourself together, it’s all things,” she added.

item.title: Jared Leto performs in Ukraine with band
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Jared Leto and his band 30 Seconds to Mars performed at a concert in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
Jared Leto and his band 30 Seconds to Mars performed at a concert in Ukraine.

Oscar-winning actor Jared Leto and his band 30 Seconds to Mars performed at a concert in Ukraine.

Leto made headlines weeks ago for paying tribute to Ukrainians while accepting the Best Supporting Actor prize for ‘Dallas Buyers Club’ at the 2014 Academy Awards, reported Digital Spy.

30 Seconds to Mars played a gig in Kiev’s Maiden Square with Leto praising the Ukrainian people by waving the country’s flag.

“You guys are in the midst of something really beautiful and it may be difficult, but there’s no price too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself,” he said.

“And I want to let you know, I understand other bands have cancelled their shows, but there was no way, 30 Seconds to Mars wasn’t going to be here in this beautiful city, in this great country here tonight.”

item.title: ‘X-Men: Apocalypse’ will have mass destruction: Director
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Bryan Singer has revealed that 'X-Men: Apocalypse' will have 'mass destruction' in a way the franchise has never seen before.
item.content:encoded:
Bryan Singer has revealed that ‘X-Men: Apocalypse’ will have ‘mass destruction’ in a way the franchise has never seen before.

Director Bryan Singer has revealed that the forthcoming ‘X-Men: Apocalypse’ will have ‘mass destruction’ in a way the franchise has never seen before.

The director, who returns to the series with this summer’s ‘X-Men: Days of Future Past’, shed light on the storyline for the superhero movie, reported Total Film
magazine.

“We’re going to deal with the notion of ancient mutants – the fact they were born and existed thousands of years ago,” Singer said.

“But it’ll be a contemporary movie – well, it’ll take place in the ’80s… The ’80s is a period now – it’s hard for me to believe that. ‘Apocalypse’ will have more of the mass destruction that ‘X-Men’ films, to date, have not relied upon. There’s definitely now a character and a story that allow room for that kind of spectacle,” he added.

‘X-Men: Apocalypse’ will open in cinemas on May 27, 2016. ‘X-Men: Days of Future Past’ will be released on May 22.

item.title: Miley Cyrus inks sad cat on her inner lip
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Miley Cyrus has got a colourful sad cat inked on her inner lip.
item.content:encoded:
Miley Cyrus has got a colourful sad cat inked on her inner lip.

Pop star Miley Cyrus has got a colourful sad cat inked on her inner lip.

The 21-year-old singer, who has been grabbing eyeballs with her bizarre stage antics during her on-going Bangerz tour, posted a close-up selfie on Instagram revealing her “sad kitty” tattoo, reported Daily Mirror.

“Sad Kitty,” Cyrus captioned the photo. In the picture, Cyrus is looking up at the camera as she flaunts the face of a yellow and black cat.

In a second snapshot, the ‘Wrecking Ball’ has given her fans a closer view of her tattoo. It shows a blue tear running down the cat’s cheek.

Last year Cyrus had inked the portrait of her grandmother on her right forearm.

item.title: Shah Rukh Khan: ‘Bhoothnath Returns’ will be one of three big hits of 2014
item.dc:creator: divyagoyal
item.description: Shah Rukh Khan will be seen in a cameo role in Amitabh Bachchan's 'Bhoothnath Returns'.
item.content:encoded:
Shah Rukh Khan will be seen in a cameo role in Amitabh Bachchan’s ‘Bhoothnath Returns’.

Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan, who made a rage in 2013 with his rom com ‘Chennai Express’, is all praise for megastar Amitabh Bachchan’s upcoming supernatural comedy film ‘Bhoothnath Returns’.

King Khan, who has given innumerable hits in Bollywood, says that Big B’s ‘Bhoothnath Returns’ will be one of the top three hits of the year 2014.

Shah Rukh Khan made an unexpected visit to the sets of Amitabh Bachchan’s ‘Bhoothnath Returns’, in which he has a cameo.

Amitabh Bachchan wrote on his blog, “It was really sweet of Shahrukh to state quite unexpectedly as he arrived on the sets of Bhoothnath, that this film would be one of the three biggest hits of the year .. aapke muh mein ghee shakkar, laddo peda sab kuch ..”

‘Bhoothnath Returns’ also stars National Award wining actress Usha Jhadav, actor Boman Irani and child actor Parth Bhalerao in lead roles. Ranbir Kapoor will also be seen in a cameo role.

The film is a hilarious take on the prevalent political issues and sees Amitabh Bachchan as the friendly ghost who contests in local elections. The film is slated to release on April 11.

item.title: Ashton Kutcher, Mila Kunis on double date
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The duo got engaged earlier this year.
item.content:encoded:
Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis first met on the sets of their television series ‘That ’70s Show’.

Newly engaged couple Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis joined ‘Two and a Half Men’ co-star Jon
Cryer and his wife for a dinner date.

The foursome was spotted in casual clothes with Kunis opting to go makeup free, reported New York Daily News. While the 30-year-old actress showed off in a short denim dress and red heels, one thing that wasn’t visible was her new ring.

The pair started dating nearly two years ago and, after many speculations about their engagement, Kutcher reportedly popped the question earlier this year with Kunis spotted wearing the ring for the first time on February 26.

The couple, who starred alongside one another for eight seasons on ‘That ’70s Show’ where they first met, are reuniting on the small screen as Kunis is set to appear on ’Two and a Half Men’ the network announced on March 4.

media:content.media:title: Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis first met on the sets of their television series 'That '70s Show'.

item.title: ‘Bobby Jasoos’ is a wholesome entertainer, says Dia Mirza
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The actress-turned-producer said that there is a scope for such movies to be presented as wholesome entertainers for a larger audience.
item.content:encoded:
Dia Mirza: Women-dominated films have a long history in Bollywood.

Actress-producer Dia Mirza feels women-centric films in Bollywood are mostly one-sided but
things are now changing.

Dia also said that there is a scope for such movies to be presented as wholesome entertainers for a larger audience. ”Heroines have always been an essential part of films but their portrayal in cinema is not a much explored subject. Actresses are added primarily for glamour quotient,” she said.

“Women-dominated films have a long history in Bollywood, but ‘Bobby Jasoos’, a spy-thriller centred around a female detective (Vidya Balan), attempts to break into a domain until now largely occupied by male actors,” she said.

The first look of Vidya, dressed as a male beggar with beard and ragged hair, and unveiled a few weeks ago caught everyone’s attention.

“I am very excited about ‘Bobby Jasoos’ as a lover of cinema, as a maker of cinema and as an audience. The manner in which we have approached and viewed women-centric subjects is tilted only in one direction – they are gritty, deep, dark and intense,” Dia told PTI in an interview here.

“What is now refreshing is our story tellers are beginning to believe and execute women stories that are not what we think or perceive women subjects to be like. They are wholesome entertainers for everyone to see,” she said.

Dia hoped ‘Bobby Jasoos’, slated for release later this year, gets thumps up from people. ”I hope ‘Bobby Jasoos’ is loved by men as much as women. We have made this film for everybody. It is not a film for women alone or women power.”

The film, directed by Samar Shaikh, has been produced under the banner of Born Free Entertainment, co-owned by the former beauty queen and her beau Sahil Sangha.

This is Dia’s second film as a producer after `Love Breakups Zindagi’ (2011) and and she is enjoying her innings as a producer. “There is a lot of hard work as a producer and it is compelling. It is like a drug…it entices you and once you get addicted, it is very difficult to draw away from it.”

Asked if she misses acting, pat comes the reply, “Off course I do… But facilitating a film is far more meaningful and fulfilling experience.”

The 32-year-old model-turned-actor was seen walking the ramp for ace designer Anita Dongre last night at the Lakme Fashion Week. Dia said she still gets nervous while on ramp.

“You feel that adrenaline rush…the attack of anxiety is there. But once you hit the ramp the energy from the audience helps, it is a great high to be on ramp.”

media:content.media:title: Dia Mirza: Women-dominated films have a long history in Bollywood.

item.title: Amitabh Bachchan presents Green Awards
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: At the event, the actor spoke about our responsibility towards our planet and the need for sustainable growth.
item.content:encoded:
Amitabh Bachchan presents Maneka Gandhi with a special award for her contribution towards animal protection.

Bollywood megstar Amitabh Bachchan was invited to present the prestigious Olive Crown Awards, Asia’s only green award for communication on planet earth held in Hotel Palladium, Parel, Mumbai.

The green awards were organized by International Advertising Association (IAA) for creative excellence in communicating sustainability.

Big B spoke about our responsibility towards our planet and the need for sustainable growth. “There is an urgent need to implement the resolutions of Kyoto Protocol and Copenhagen Summit,” he said.

“It is the poorest and least contributing countries in the world like our neighbour Bangladesh who are the worst sufferers of climatic changes created by excessive industrialization and carbon footprints by overambitious western economies, namely the US and European countries”.

He then concluded, “It is need of the hour that we all work towards sustainable growth which will survive through our planet and future generations.”

Mr. Prasoon Joshi and his O&M team received the Olive Crown Award, whereas Mrs. Maneka Gandhi won a special award for her contribution towards animal protection.

media:content.media:title: Amitabh Bachchan presents Maneka Gandhi with a special award for her contribution towards animal protection.

item.title: Jennifer Hudson cuts ties with Weight Watchers
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The songstress and the weight-loss brand have parted ways after four years.
item.content:encoded:
Jennifer Hudson: My experience with Weight Watchers has truly been life changing. (Reuters)

Though her body remains testament to its success, singer-actress Jennifer Hudson is no longer a face of Weight Watchers.

The ‘Dreamgirls’ star and the weight-loss brand have parted ways after four years, her commitment to the company fulfilled, her representative said, reported E! online.

“My experience with Weight Watchers has truly been life changing. I am grateful for what I have learned throughout the process and will always take it with me. I have chosen to step away from my role as ambassador and I am excited for the year to come, with many new projects and lots of new music,” “ Hudson said in a statement.

Speculation about a possibly not-very-amicable split circulated after Hudson tweeted, “Sometimes you have to step back and let your work speak for you, and when that doesn’t work you walk away knowing you did your best…It’s been fun and a pleasure good luck to you all @WeightWatchers.”

Hudson welcomed son David in 2009 and hooked up with Weight Watchers the following year—and never looked back.

The ‘American Idol’ castoff turned Oscar winner ultimately shed 80 pounds and became quite the red-carpet standout, having gone from a size 16 to a 6.

media:content.media:title: Jennifer Hudson: My experience with Weight Watchers has truly been life changing. (Reuters)

item.title: Backstreet Boys announce North American tour
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The band will head to the US on May 22 for a concert at WaMu Theater in Seattle.
item.content:encoded:
The Backstreet Boys will hit the road again this summer. (Reuters)

Pop/rock band Backstreet Boys have announced that they would hit the road again this summer.

After a string of Canadian shows, the tour will head to the US on May 22 for a concert at WaMu Theater in Seattle. They’ll then make stops in other cities like Sacramento, Las Vegas, Los Angeles, Houston, Oklahoma City, Chicago, Detroit, Boston and Philadelphia before wrapping things up at Jones Beach Theater in New York, reported Ace Showbiz.

“Due to overwhelming demand on Facebook and Twitter, Backstreet’s back, all right!” they said during their appearance on a TV show.

Singer Avril Lavigne has also been tapped to support the tour. ”We really wanted to put together a great show and do our best to give everyone their money’s worth. Avril is an unbelievably talented artist who’s a perfect fit to make these shows extra special for our fans.”

media:content.media:title: The Backstreet Boys will hit the road again this summer. (Reuters)

item.title: Karan Johar completes 20 years in Bollywood
item.dc:creator: apurva1702
item.description: Karan Johar has given several Bollywood hits both as a producer and a director.
item.content:encoded:
Karan Johar gets nostalgic on completing 20 years in Bollywood.

Filmmaker Karan Johar, who has given several Bollywood hits both as a producer and a director, recalls his days when he joined hands with Chopra clan’s Aditya Chopra to give the blockbuster hit ‘Dilwale Dulhania Le Jaayenge’ 20 years back.

Karan Johar, who considers Aditya Chopra to be his mentor and the reason for him to be in the film industry, today tweeted:

I joined Aditya Chopra exactly 20 years ago as an Assistant Director on #DDLJ…he is my mentor and the reason I am in the movies today…

— Karan Johar (@karanjohar) March 15, 2014

‘Kuch Kuch Hota Hai’ director got nostalgic and remembered his journey to the Yash Raj Films office on March 15, 1994. He tweeted:

I remember the journey from my house to the YRF office on the 15th of March,1994…remember wondering if this is the right career choice…

— Karan Johar (@karanjohar) March 15, 2014

 

Missing the two important people in his life, Karan said, “I miss my father and Yash uncle tremendously today…Adi and me are blessed to have them look over us constantly…”

Karan Johar’s last directorial venture was ‘Student of the Year’ and partially ‘Bombay Talkies. He has Alia Bhatt and Arjun Kapoor starrer ’2 States’ coming up under his production banner Dharma Productions.

He will soon be seen in Anurag Kashyap’s Bombay Velvet.

media:content.media:title: Karan Johar gets nostalgic on completing 20 years in Bollywood.

item.title: Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra to produce TV show on social issues
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The show will deal with social causes and is tentatively titled 'Sone Ka Dil'.
item.content:encoded:
Raj Kundra and Shilpa Shetty’s show is said to have a different format as compared to ‘Satyamev Jayate’.

There have been frequent rumours about Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra planning to produce a TV show and now, Raj Kundra recently revealed that they will indeed be making a show which will deal with social causes tentatively titled ‘Sone Ka Dil’.

Denying the comparisons with Aamir’s popular show ‘Satyamev Jayate’, this show is said to have a different format where the team will honour the people who are working towards development in the society by presenting gold medals or coins as well as promote NGOs where Raj and Shilpa will also be donating for these charitable causes.

Though currently the airing slot and the rest of the details of the show are being worked out, Raj announced that they have found thirteen people from different parts of India whose efforts will be acknowledged in the show.

He also added that they have shot a music video for the show titled Bharat Bhagya Vidhata which is sung by Altamash Faridi and composed by Palash Muchhal.

media:content.media:title: Raj Kundra and Shilpa Shetty's show is said to have a different format as compared to 'Satyamev Jayate'.

item.title: Saif Ali Khan and friends pleaded not guilty in assault case
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The actor was arrested two years ago after the businessman Iqbal accused the actor of breaking his nose.
item.content:encoded:
Saif Ali Khan pleads not guilty after being charged for assaulting an NRI businessman.

A few years back, Nawab Saif Ali Khan was charged for assaulting an NRI businessman from South Africa named Iqbal Sharma at the Taj Hotel in Mumbai. And now, after the charges were read by the court, the actor and the others accused Bilal Amrohi and Shakeel Ladak have been pleaded not guilty.

Saif was arrested two years ago after the businessman Iqbal accused the actor of breaking his nose and beating up his father-in-law with his friends at a five star hotel in Mumbai.

However, the actor was given bail and in a public apology and statement to the media, Saif had claimed that he did not hit the businessman and had lost his cool because the businessman was abusing the ladies in their group which included Kareena Kapoor, Amrita Arora and Malaika Arora Khan.

media:content.media:title: Saif Ali Khan pleads not guilty after being charged for assaulting an NRI businessman.

item.title: Anil Kapoor gears up for Season 2 of ’24′
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: Anil Kapoor: My entire team is into pre-production. Only my own dates need to be worked out.
item.content:encoded:
Last year, Anil Kapoor declined all movie offers in order to focus on ’24′.

The game-changing serial ’24′ is all set to go into Season 2. Yup, it’s time for Anil Kapoor to don the producer’s hat once again, even if it is to be done at the cost of his film offers.

Apparently, Anil has 6 major film offers this year. But he is tempted to again give priority to ’24′. Confirming his full-throttle plans for Season 2 Anil says, “My entire team is into pre-production. Only my own dates need to be worked out. I am in a bit of a fix.”

Last year, Anil said no to all movie offers in order to focus on ’24′. This year, the movie offers have piled up but Anil is in the mood for Season 2 of the series. Confesses the director, “There are quite a number of tempting film offers. But I haven’t said yes to them as yet. I need to work out my dates for Season 2 of ’24′. That’s a commitment I’ve made to myself. As a movie actor I’ve seen and done it all. Television is a new medium for me. And it’s very exciting.”

So would Anil end up doing no films in 2014? “I am already doing Anees Bazmee’s Welcome Back. So I’ve a major film coming up this year. As for more movies, they would depend on how much time Season 2 of ’24′ would need. You see, the first season was tougher with the entire machinery and logistics of television being new to me. A lot of the production hassles would be automatically lessened this time,” reveals Anil excitedly.

The one thing that is most certainly going to be seen in Season 2 of ’24′ is the core cast of Anil Kapoor, Tisca Chopra and Mandira Bedi. Rishi Kapoor and Jeetendra are likely to join the cast. “Let’s see how it goes. I am even more excited about Season 2,” reveals Anil who took a few days off this week to attend his brother Sanjay Kapoor’s brother-in-law’s wedding.

media:content.media:title: Last year, Anil Kapoor declined all movie offers in order to focus on '24'.

item.title: Sonam Kapoor: The bikini was my idea, not Aditya Chopra’s
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: We've seen number of Yash Raj heroines from the old Sonam in 'Vijay' (1983) to today's Sonam Kapoor in 'Bewakoofiyan' don the bikini.
item.content:encoded:
Sonam Kapoor: I wasn’t really tense about wearing a bikini.

You’d think that Sonam Kapoor is only carrying forward the illustrious Yash Raj legacy by getting into a bikini for Bewakoofiyan. After all, we’ve seen number of Yash Raj heroines from the old Sonam in Vijay (1983) to today’s Sonam Kapoor in Bewakoofiyan don the bikini.

But Sonam springs a saucy surprise by saying the bikini was her idea. “It wasn’t the producer Aditya Chopra or the director Nupur Asthana’s idea that I wear a bikini. In fact, the director suggested a one-piece bathing costume. But I thought a bikini was fine. If you see the trailer there are two young people going for swim. It’s perfectly natural for the girl to be in a bikini. It’s not Halle Berry in a James Bond film or Bipasha Basu in Dhoom making a splash. The bikini blends naturally into the scene. And I am very happy to be wearing one. Having a female director around helped. But I wasn’t really tense about wearing a bikini.”

Sonam’s father Anil Kapoor has apparently said that Sonam’s bikini shot would get Bewakoofiyan a good opening. Sonam completely refutes any such statement from her father. “My father never said that. All that I said at a press meet was that my father feels the film would get a good opening. That statement found itself bonding with the bikini in the newspaper headlines. I’ve realized I have to be very careful in what I say. I speak my heart out. Such honesty is not appreciated in the film industry. Instead, it is twisted and distorted. A lot of what I say is lost in translation.”

Sonam is very happy to have done a frothy feel-happy film like Bewakoofiyan. “Finally! I’ve been doing too many intense films from Saawariya, Delhi 6, Mausam and last year there was Raanjhanaa and Bhaag Milkha Bhaag. After doing Bewakoofiyan I realized I hadn’t done any conventional films at all.”

Bewakoofiyan helped Sonam to relax. “I needed to unwind, just have fun doing a role. Also, some of my films have taken longer to be completed than usual. This one took only 40 days to shoot. It wasn’t a marathon race but more like a quick run. It was chicken soup for my soul. It was a very easy smooth slip-in-slip-out kind of shoot. I never realized when we started the shooting and when it ended.”

The other factor that Sonam found relaxing in Bewakoofiyan was the rom-com format. “I have two heroine-centric films Khoobsurat and Dolly Ki Doli lined up. Before I went into these films where I had to shoulder the film’s weight, I needed to do something where both the leads had equal responsibility to share. Bewakoofiyan was liberating.”

The film’s sensibility is very close to Sonam’s personality. “Bewakoofiyan is a frothy American rom-com kind of film about urban kids. Since both Ayushmann and I are urban youngsters it was relatively easy for us to identify with the situations in the script.”

Remind her that Ayushmann is from Chandigarh which is not that urbanized a background and Sonam protests, “Oh, you’ll be surprised at how urban Chandigarh has become. I’ve shot there recently. Believe me, it is no longer a small town. And besides, Ayushmann has spent most of his life in Delhi. So his sensibilities are very urban. I had great fun shooting with him.”

media:content.media:title: Sonam Kapoor: I wasn't really tense about wearing a bikini.

item.title: Alia Bhatt celebrates birthday shooting for ‘Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania’
item.dc:creator: apurva1702
item.description: Bollywood's little glam doll Alia Bhatt turns 21 today.
item.content:encoded:
Alia Bhatt was born to Mahesh Bhatt and Soni Razdan.

Bollywood’s little glam doll Alia Bhatt turns 21 today. Two-film-old star Alia Bhatt was born to filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt and actress Soni Razdan on March 15, 1993. Alia, who made her debut as a young, rich glamorous student in Karan Johar’s ‘Student of the Year’, was appreciated for her performance in her second film ‘Highway’.

Alia is celebrating her 21st birthday not partying and chilling, but shooting for her another forthcoming film, ‘Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania’ where Alia plays a Punjabi girl opposite her ‘Student of the Year’ co star Varun Dhawan.

Alia tweeted:

Morning :) thank youu all for the love and wishes!!! Love you guys :)Celebrating my birthday shooting for humpty.. Best feeling ever !!

— Alia Bhatt (@aliaa08) March 15, 2014

The pretty actress who has impressed all with Imtiaz Ali’s ‘Highway’ and is ready with her third film ’2 States’.

Alia’s chemistry with her co-star and rumoured beau Arjun Kapoor is steaming hot. Alia is looking convincing in the character she’s playing.

We wish Alia Bhatt a very Happy Birthday!

media:content.media:title: Alia Bhatt was born to Mahesh Bhatt and Soni Razdan.

item.title: The tongue-in-cheek ‘Bewakoofiyaan’ review
item.dc:creator: apurva1702
item.description: Bewakoofiyaan offers its viewers to become a part of the movie experience.
item.content:encoded:
Bewakoofiyaan review.

Bewakoofiyaan offers its viewers to become a part of the movie experience: if you watch the film expecting a Queen or a Hasee Toh Phasee, you are pretty much doing what the title says. Though the lead pair does a decent job, they are burdened with a tired script and a cliched concept.

As usual, our reporter interviewed celeb watchers of the film to figure out what they thought of Bewakoofiyan. In keeping with the mood of the season, his first three interviewees were the three top political figures in India today.

Before he could tell Arvind that Mango is not exactly an Aam Aadmi brand, he was left alone. After the AAP supremo, it was the turn of Narendra Modi.

Finally, Rahul Gandhi turned up, and our reporter prepared himself for prepared answers.

After the political heavyweights of the present, it was the turn of a literal political heavyweight from millenia ago.

Our reporter left in confusion, telling himself that Ra.One might actually have been a better viewing choice.

- By Antara and Jheel for Laugh Out Loud Ventures

item.title: Lady Gaga worries she’s got fat
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The singer admitted her weight fluctuates because of her love of Italian food.
item.content:encoded:
Lady Gaga has been gorging on barbecue food and meat during her stay in Austin. (Reuters)

Pop star Lady Gaga claims she has put on weight by eating meat during her stay in Austin, Texas, for the South by Southwest festival.

The 27-year-old singer, who has admitted her weight fluctuates because of her love of Italian food, has been gorging on barbecue food and meat during her stay in Austin, reported E! online.

“That’s actually why I wore it because I am really fat right now because I have been eating BBQ. I had some at Stubb’s because I am playing there and some Salt Lick too. Or any meat that I find on the street, I just eat,” the singer said.

Gaga has been soaking up the atmosphere at the festival, where she will deliver the SXSW keynote speech with Fuse’s John Norris.

media:content.media:title: Lady Gaga has been gorging on barbecue food and meat during her stay in Austin. (Reuters)

item.title: Kayne West is a genuine man: John Legend
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: John Legend feels that people judge Kanye West wrong and is often criticised for his public rants.
item.content:encoded:
John Legend on Kanye West: He is so honest that people think there must be something else behind it. (Reuters)

Singer-songwriter John Legend says Kanye West is a genuine person and people judge him wrong.

Legend, 35, who has worked with West several times, said that that they do argue for bringing out the best for their album and he sometimes goes against West’s wish, reported Contactmusic.

“We always have differences of opinion. We try to get to a place where we agree on a song, but occasionally I put something on that I love and Kanye isn’t too fond of,” Legend said.

Legend feels that people judge West wrong and is often criticised for his public rants. ”He is so honest that people think there must be something else behind it, but it’s just him telling the truth as he sees it. We place a premium on being polite, but it’s not the most necessary thing.”

“If you look at what Kanye says and does, it might upset our sense of politeness, but has he ever actually hurt anybody? No,” he added.

media:content.media:title: John Legend on Kanye West: He is so honest that people think there must be something else behind it. (Reuters)

item.title: I earn less but feel enriched touching lives: Aamir Khan on ‘Satyamev Jayate’
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: There were reports that Aamir was not charging anything for the show.
item.content:encoded:
Aamir Khan: I used to earn more money through ads but I don’t do much ads now. (Photo: Varinder Chawla)

Superstar Aamir Khan, who is currently busy with his TV show ‘Satyamev Jayate’ says that his monetary earnings from the programme are less but he is enriched by the experience of meeting different people.

There were reports that Aamir was not charging anything for the show but the actor said, “I do take money for the show… I think I should take money for the work I do. I used to earn more money through ads but I don’t do much ads now. If I look at it financially, commercially… then I am earning less.

“(But) My earning is more in another way… like meeting people from various walks of life, touching their lives. I feel enriched,” Aamir told reporters here.

‘Satyamev Jayate’ has been one of the most influential television shows in the recent times. The first season saw Aamir raising some sensitive topics like female foeticide, child sexual abuse, medical malpractice, dowry system, love marriages and honour killings among others.

In the second season, which kicked off on March 2, issues like rape and police reforms were raised. The actor, however, did not elaborate on the subjects, which would be highlighted in the upcoming episodes.

On ensuing polls, he said, “I will come forward for an issue… but I will not campaign… support any party or person. I know people in politics. I don’t want to influence anyone. I think youngsters should vote… think and vote.”

In the past, Aamir did support social activist Anna Hazare when he was fighting for corruption. On AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal, Aamir said, “It is a
new party let’s see what kind of work they do. I don’t want to comment on them right now.”

His good friend Salman Khan too would be seen in a social show ‘Mission Sapne’, where the celebrity would be leading the life of a common man for a day and give the earnings to them
(common man).

“I am very happy Salman is doing this kind of a show. I wish more people from industry come and support it (social issues),” Aamir said.

media:content.media:title: Aamir Khan: I used to earn more money through ads but I don't do much ads now. (Photo: Varinder Chawla)

item.title: A Little This, A Little That
item.dc:creator: 24sneha
item.description: Making up for the infusion of sounds, BBC’s minimalistic vocals polish up the style they have been tampering with, successfully so, since 2006.
item.content:encoded:
Bombay Bicycle Club

So Long, See You Tomorrow

Bombay Bicycle Club

Universal/Island

Rs 1,144

Rating: **** 1/2

Much like the now-defunct London restaurant they’ve adopted their name from, there’s warm comfort in the familiarity that Bombay Bicycle Club (BBC) instills in an Indian listener. It’s the kind of sentiment that an ’80s or ’90s child probably experienced when, while listening to Poison, Nirvana or The Smiths, she found an occasional Cornershop, brimming with Indian notes fused with British post-punk sounds. Or chanced upon Goldspot, the British indie-pop outfit known for their “retro filmi” influences.

But in So Long, See You Tomorrow, BBC — with Jack Steadman (on vocals, guitar, piano) at the helm, Jamie MacColl (guitar), Suren de Saram (drums) and Ed Nash (bass) — doesn’t just create an easy ambience. It infuses a pinch of blues (used in their debut album I Had the Blues But I Shook Them Loose) and folk tunes (used in Flaws) in its crisp electronic pop soundscape.

The first image that comes to mind with the track Feel is the amorous snake dance in the film Nagin (1976). The track starts with the familiar Man Dole Tera Tan Dole’s shehnai tune embellished with booming bass, smoothly progressing to danceable techno pop. Further, there is a brief grungy version of the “Nagin song” interlude, followed by “Our love was lost, oh lost/And then forgotten like an old song/ You said your life went on”. Luna, on the other hand, even though ridden with tabla musings, is a psychedelic mix of female chorus and trance-like sea of sounds.

With the intensity reminiscent of the British jazz-electronic outfit, The Cinematic Orchestra, and a wholesome diversity of sounds (Bollywood samples laced with orchestral-quality stringed instrumentals, for instance), Overdone is set against turntablist and electronic elements. Steadman’s restrained vocals, sweeping in and out of occasional chorus, make the track a concert-goer’s dream.

Carry me struts heavily with mixed emotions of dub, pop  and techno, a repetitive “You carry me” reverberating across the  sounds. Tracks such as Home by now, Eyes off you and Whenever, wherever are mellow.

Making up for the infusion of sounds, BBC’s minimalistic vocals polish up the style they have been tampering with, successfully so, since 2006. The 10-track album concludes with the titular song So long, see you tomorrow. It’s a clean-cut composition, but goes astray with Steadman’s inexhaustible “When you reign it down, lights come/ You go round and round and round” in loop for six minutes. Once it’s over, So long… leaves one with a disconcertingly bittersweet aftertaste, a good sign of more to come from one of the most underrated bands from London.

item.title: Stage is set for the Ghanta Awards 2014
item.dc:creator: apurva1702
item.description: Now that Filmfare Awards, Screen Awards, etc etc are long gone, it’s time for the Ghanta Awards.
item.content:encoded:
Ghanta Awards 2014

Now that Filmfare Awards, Screen Awards, etc etc are long gone, it’s time for the Ghanta Awards. India’s version of the Golden Raspberry Awards (Razzies), the Ghanta Awards recognize the worst in Bollywood.

The nominations bash recently took place in Delhi at the Stein auditoriumin the India Habitat Centre. The hosts for the evening were five stand-up comedians – Sorabh Pant and his ‘East India Comedy’ members – Kunal Rao, Sahil Shah, Darsheel Safary and Azeem Banatwalla.

The night saw spoofs and singing with parodies on Bollywood using songs by the Backstreet Boys and even one Alok Nath, who was a trending topic on Twitter last month.

The categories included worst actor, actress, and director with a new category this season was ‘Kuoting Krap with Karan’, inspired from Karan Johar’s talk show ‘Koffee with Karan’.

item.title: Movie review: 3 Days To Kill
item.dc:creator: apurva1702
item.description: If this is a celebration of absurdities, she is the one dressed for the party.
item.content:encoded:
Movie review: 3 Days To Kill.


Director: McG
Casting: Kevin Costner, Hailee Steinfeld, Connie Nielsen, Amber Heard
The Indian Express rating: **

NORMAL folks would think twice accepting a syringe full of an experimental drug from a woman in skin-tight leather, high heels, red lips, crazy wigs, a flashy car and, most importantly, some incredulous association with the CIA. No such thought flits across Ethan’s (Costner) mind. Himself a retired CIA agent, he has presumably seen weirder things in life, even weirder than the aforementioned ‘Vivi (Heard)’.

You are willing to grant 3 Days to Kill that, given that director McG and writer-co-screenwriter Luc Besson have Charlies Angels, Terminator Salvation, Transporter, The Fifth Element and many other light-on-feet action films between them. Besson even managed a hit with Taken, a similar story as 3 Days to Kill about a retired CIA agent and his daughter, played by an equally scruffy, deadbeat Liam Neeson. However, this one fails to even rise to that level, for the action is too tired, the humour too forced, the relationship too cliched, an accompanying storyline too unbelievable (even compared to Vivi), and children just too many to have around guns.

Vivi first spots Ethan during an operation gone wrong in Serbia, in which blasts go around a suitcase with nuclear bombs. Never mind, what’s more troubling is the bad cough Ethan has — hardly ever the case of the flu in movies. Sure enough, he discovers he has “brain cancer, which has spread to the lungs”, with a couple of months to live. Ethan leaves the Agency and decides to spend that time making up to his estranged wife and the teenage daughter he barely knows.

Wife Christina (Nielsen) and daughter Zoey (Steinfeld) are not very welcoming, though the former melts on hearing about his medical condition. The film is about how Ethan wins Zoey over, while fighting the bad guys and, often, taking parenting and cooking tips from them. If only it was that alone, for there are few as winning as Costner in such thankless roles. However, Vivi keeps reappearing, seeking Ethan’s help for a reason that is not supposed to make sense, and claiming an association with the CIA that should have the Agency worried. In exchange, she offers Ethan the experimental drug that may or may not extend his life.

With little coherent thought intended, the film is neither about Ethan’s desperation or his love for Zoey, nor about the bad guys threatening him. That McG is capable is clear from the scene where Ethan teaches Zoey how to ride a bicycle, as she asks the questions she has always wanted to from her absentee father.

Rather, as Costner suffers though a lot else, including witnessing childbirth by a woman who is no more than a stranger, it’s Heard who may get the best career bump. If this is a celebration of absurdities, she is the one dressed for the party.

item.title: Eight Indian movies to be screened at Muscat film festival
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The list will include five Malayalam movies.
item.content:encoded:
‘Celluloid’ will also be screened at the Muscat International Film Festival.

A total of eight Indian films, including five from Kerala, are scheduled to be screened at this year’s Muscat International Film Festival (MIFF) to be held from March 23 till 29.

According to organizers of the festival, besides the five Malayalam movies there will be one movie each in Hindi, Bengali and Oriya.

‘Celluloid’, ‘Adaminte Makan Abu’, ‘Pazhassi Raja’, ’Orissa’ and ‘Artist’ are the Malayalam movies to be screened during the festival.

“The movie ‘Artist’ will be competing in the best foreign language category at the film fest,” Riju Ram, who is organizing Indian movies at the film fest, said.

Directed by Shyamaprasad, ‘Artist’ is an adaptation of Dreams In Prussian Blue, a paperback novel by Paritosh Uttam. The film is about two fine arts students, both driven by individual ambitions, who decide to live together.

Mammootty will be the special guest at the closing ceremony. He said that they are trying to include another Malayalam movie, ‘Shutter’, to be screened at the festival.

media:content.media:title: 'Celluloid' will also be screened at the Muscat Film Festival.

item.title: Matt Damon signed up new film without reading script
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The actor signed up for Terry Gilliam's 'The Zero Theorem'.
item.content:encoded:
Matt damon will be seen in Terry Gilliam’s new sci-fi drama ‘The Zero Theorem’. (Reuters)

Actor Matt Damon signed up to appear in director Terry Gilliam’s new sci-fi drama ‘The Zero Theorem without even reading the script.

Gilliam admits casting ‘The Bourne Identity’ star in the low-budget drama because he was ready and willing to do whatever was required of him, reported Contactmusic.

“I called Matt and said, ‘I’ve got a small part for you, probably four or five days, I’ll send you the script.’ He said, ‘Don’t bother, I’m in,’” Gilliam said.

And Damon was not the only star who signed on to work with Gilliam without a script read or an agreed salary. Tilda Swinton and ‘Skyfall’ actor Ben Whishaw also jumped at the chance to team up with him.

“(Tilda and I) had met at different festivals and always said we ought to work together, Ben Whishaw, the same thing. And basically I just called them and they all just came and they worked for scale, that’s how we made the film, because we didn’t have the budget,” Gilliam added.

‘The Zero Theorem’ centres on a reclusive computer hacker, played by Christoph Waltz, who attempts to discover the reason for human existence.

media:content.media:title: Matt damon will be seen in Terry Gilliam's new sci-fi drama 'The Zero Theorem'. (Reuters)

item.title: Aamir Khan turns 49, dedicates the year to Satyamev Jayate
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: Aamir Khan said: "I have 'PK' releasing in Christmas and then we have 'Satyamev Jayate' and we will show it in three parts. This year, I am dedicating to 'Satyamev Jayate'."
item.content:encoded:
This year, I have ‘PK’ releasing in Christmas and then we have ‘Satyamev Jayate’ and we will show it in three parts. This year, I am dedicating to ‘Satyamev Jayate’,” he added. (Photo: Varinder Chawla)

Superstar Aamir Khan, who turned 49 on Friday (March 14), will be spending a quiet birthday with his family. “I am happy to be turning 49. I have learnt a lot in life. It was an exciting journey… I am grateful for the love I have received. I am thankful to God, fans. I hope to lead a healthy life,” Aamir Khan told reporters. (See Pics: Aamir Khan turns 49, celebrates birthday with fans)

It was Aamir’s wife Kiran Rao who wished him first. “It is family time today. I am going to spend the day with family,” he said.

Aamir Khan said he is expecting a call from good friend Salman Khan. “He has not called me yet. If he remembers he will wish. I hope he calls,” he added.. (Photos: Happy Birthday Aamir Khan)

Aamir Khan had a wonderful 2013 and he hopes to replicate it this year as well. “Last year, ‘Dhoom 3′ released and it did very well.

Aamir Khan had a wonderful 2013 and he hopes to replicate it this year as well. “Last year, ‘Dhoom 3′ released and it did very well. This year, I have ‘PK’ releasing in Christmas and then we have ‘Satyamev Jayate’ and we will show it in three parts. This
year, I am dedicating to ‘Satyamev Jayate’,” he added.  (See pics: Aamir Khan’s top roles)

Born to film producer Tahir Hussain and Zeenat, the actor-producer has given memorable and blockbuster films like ‘Qayamat Se Qayamat Tak’, ‘Dil’, ‘Sarfarosh’, ‘Lagaan’, ‘Dil Chahta Hai’ ‘Rang De Basanti’, ‘Taare Zameen Par’, ’3 Idiots’ among others.

item.title: Watch: Salman Khan jumps from a plane in deadly new ad
item.dc:creator: sunitrapacheco
item.description: The actor is shown in his usual macho style, jumping out from a plane in a jeep.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Mary Kom shoots her life story in 3 minutes
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: The boxer, whose rise from poverty to being a global sports icon is now being made into a film starring Priyanka Chopra, was a "natural" before the camera.
item.content:encoded:
The boxer, whose rise from poverty to being a global sports icon is now being made into a film starring Priyanka Chopra, was a “natural” before the camera.

Filmmaker Shoojit Sircar has done in 3 minutes what Priyanka Chopra would take 3 hours to say. In an ad that he shot over three days last week, Shoojit got boxing champion Mary Kom to enact her own life on camera.

“It was a remarkably inspiring three-day shoot. Though it’s an ad we got Mary Kom to feature in it. And we encapsulated every phase of her life from her childhood struggle for a decent life to her hard-working teens to her current status as boxing champ and a home-maker, we got all of this into the script in just a three-minute film,” says Shoojit

The director says it was a huge challenge to get Mary Kom’s life on to the film in such meager footage. “I wanted it to be an inspirational saga told in just a few minutes. I didn’t want her to come across as a model selling a product but a responsible citizen selling an idea to the millions who look up to her. I had never expected her to be so camera-friendly.”

The boxer, whose rise from poverty to being a global sports icon is now being made into a film starring Priyanka Chopra, was a “natural” before the camera.

“It was such a pleasure shooting with Mary Kom. She came to the sets with no attitude or fixed notions. She surrendered to whatever the script demanded. She was fully there with me, collaborating and participating like a true member of the crew,” says Shoojit.

media:content.media:title: The boxer, whose rise from poverty to being a global sports icon is now being made into a film starring Priyanka Chopra, was a "natural" before the camera.

item.title: Kangana, Abhay launch Bollywood in Britain app

Kangana Ranaut and Abhay Deol at the Bollywood in Britain app launch. (Photo: Varinder Chawla)

VisitBritain launched the first of its kind mobile app called Bollywood in Britain (BiB) on March 12, 2014 at an event, which saw the likes of Kangana Ranaut, Abhay Deol, Boman Irani and Tara Sharma.

The app enables users to experince the various aspects of Britain. It is mainly a tourist guide app and is intended to help Indian tourists visiting Britain on places to visit while sharing engaging Bollywood trivia related to that particular location.

The key features of Bollywood in Britain include Travel Guide Map, Destination Search, Flip Tour which shares Celeb Stories and Destination Recommendation, Community window and Love Wall, the app also offers to update and share one’s experiences on social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter.

Bollywood in Britain is now available on Google Play Store.

item.title: I had Rs 10,000 in my account when I got married: Ayushmann Khurrana
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: Ayushmann Khurrana, who is playing a bankrupt lover in rom-com 'Bewakoofiyaan', said the film took him to his earlier days when he had only Rs 10,000 as savings for marriage.
item.content:encoded:
“But I don’t relate to the joblessness. I rather feel I was always at the right place at the right time,” said Ayushmann Khurrana.

Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, who is playing a bankrupt lover in rom-com ‘Bewakoofiyaan‘, said the film took him to his earlier days when he had only Rs 10,000 as savings for marriage.

The 29-year-old ‘Vicky Donor’ star said he eventually overcame his financial troubles by finding fame in showbiz.

“I have not struggled much in my career as my character (Mohit Chadhdha) in the film does. I did face rejections but was never bogged down. I only relate to the financial insecurity part of my character. I remember when I married Tahira, I only had Rs 10,000 in my account.  But I don’t relate to the joblessness. I rather feel I was always at the right place at the right time,” said Ayushmann Khurrana.

The actor married his childhood sweetheart Tahira before entering Bollywood.

‘Bewakoofiyaan’, also starring Sonam Kapoor and veteran actor Rishi Kapoor in prominent roles, hit theatres today. The love-story is set in the backdrop of recession.

“I am not nervous but I have always been excited about my every release. I am getting good response because it’s a quirky and edgy film. It’s a young film. I think effects of
recession are still there as people continue to get pink slips. There is a lot of unemployment in India due to the recession,” Ayushmann said.

Asked if Tahira has watched the film yet, the ‘Pani Da’ hitmaker said, “She is in Chandigarh now. I am planning to fly down to Chandigarh by evening and we are going to watch it. But she has read the script.”

Ayushmann, who has teamed up with Sonam for the first time in the film, said he was initially sceptical about the onscreen chemistry with the fashionista.

“Before starting the shoot, I was sceptical about our onscreen pairing. She is fashion conscious and I am boy-next-door. But after meeting her I realised that she is a
nice girl who is pure at heart. This is how I feel our chemistry rocked onscreen,” he said.

Ayushmann is currently shooting for his next Yash Raj Films venture ‘Dum Laga Ke Haisha’ in Rishikesh and Haridwar. Directed by Maneesh Sharma, the story revoles around the life of a small town couple.

The actor also learnt Marathi for ‘Bambai Fairytale’, where he is playing eminent scientist Shivkar Bapuji Talpade.

item.title: ‘Captain America 3′ to collide with Batman/Superman at BO
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: Marvel Studios and parent company Disney first declared that they would be releasing a big film on May 6 as they have been releasing first weekend of summer for past decade.
item.content:encoded:
Marvel Studios and parent company Disney first declared that they would be releasing a big film on May 6 as they have been releasing first weekend of summer for past decade.

Two of the biggest superhero films are set for a showdown at the box office this year with Marvel and Warner Bros releasing ‘Captain America 3′ and ‘Batman/Superman’ on the same day in May.

Marvel Studios and parent company Disney first declared that they would be releasing a big film on May 6 as they have been releasing first weekend of summer for past decade.

However, Warner Bros announced in January that it would open Batman-Superman on May 6, 2016 as well. The film stars Ben Affleck as Batman and Henry Cavill once again as Superman.

The film was originally slated to release in summer 2015 but the date got pushed by a year.

Marvel Studios president Kevin Feige recently said he had no plans to shift the release date of one of his superhero films on May 6 to avoid a clash.

While Feige declined to give the name of the film, the Hollywood Reporter said it will be ‘Captain America 3′.

item.title: Kelly Osbourne removes her third tattoo
item.dc:creator: sharmasarika
item.description: The 'Fashion Police' host advised fans to "think" before committing to the permanent body art, reported Contactmusic.
item.content:encoded:
The ‘Fashion Police’ host advised fans to “think” before committing to the permanent body art, reported Contactmusic.

Singer-actress Kelly Osbourne undergone her third session of laser treatment in a bid to remove some of the tattoos on her arms.

The ‘Fashion Police’ host advised fans to “think” before committing to the permanent body art, reported Contactmusic.

“As humans we fill our conscience with cliches to selfishly justify the ridiculous things we do in life… Such as getting stupid tattoos.

“I have now undergone my third laser tattoo removal. All day I have found myself saying ‘no pain no gain’ or ‘pain is beauty!’ However the bigger lesson I have taken away from this horrendously painful experience is THINK BEFORE YOU INK!…” she said.

The singer had been considering tattoo removal for a long time. In 2010, she had revealed that she regretted the inkings and wanted to get rid of some of her body art.

“Some still have a special meaning, like the matching ones my brother Jack and I have of each other’s names, but now I feel like some were a mistake,” she added.

media:content.media:title: The 'Fashion Police' host advised fans to "think" before committing to the permanent body art, reported Contactmusic.

item.content:encoded:
The couple, who have been engaged for a year, filed for the document on March 5. They have just 30 days from the date of issuance to get hitched before they have to apply for a new licence.

Pop star Britney Spears’ younger sister Jamie Lynn has sparked rumours that she might be getting hitched to her fiance James Watson by the end of this month.

The rumours began to swirl after the couple apparently obtained a marriage licence from Tangipahoa Parish Clerk of Courts in Louisiana earlier this month, reported E! News.

The couple, who have been engaged for a year, filed for the document on March 5. They have just 30 days from the date of issuance to get hitched before they have to apply for a new licence.

Lynn, 22, had announced her engagement on Twitter by posting a picture of a stunning diamond sparkler on her ring finger.

This will be Jamie’s first marriage. She was previously engaged to ex-boyfriend Casey Aldridge, who had popped the question in 2008. Their relationship ended for good in 2010. She also has a four-year-old daughter, Maddie, with Casey.
